Reviews.Title: “disappointed visitor”
Reviews.Author: Betty F
Reviews.Content: The website photos must have been taken 20 years ago! This building is in need of total overhaul. Cigarette smoke can be smelled throughout the facility, ants in room, walls, doors,falling apart. Toilet loose on mount and made crashing noise every time it was sat on. The continental breakfast was bagels/cream cheese, or muffin, juice and coffee-picture on website misleading. Our balcony door was corroded shut. Only good things- staff friendly and helpful and nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “the Labor day weekend”
Reviews.Author: bleon34496
Reviews.Content: It was ok the hotel was not very clean it had ants and cockroach but the pool was ok and it was very noisey I had to call the front desk twice but was reasonable price but I would not come back to this hotel it really needs to be painted and fix the roof( ect)

Reviews.Title: “A+ From Us!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in October 2009 and we had 0 Problems with the Hotel, the Staff or the Room! Im not really sure why people are giving this Hotel such bad reviews but we loved it. The Beach in October was AWESOME....The water was still super Warm and there was NO one there since School was back in Session. The Pool was Great...My Husband and our Kids ran around searching for and catching Lizards. To Recap, this Hotel for the Money you pay for it is Great! Highly Recommended!! I will let you know in the Future when we go again how this Hotel is with our 2nd visit!

Reviews.Title: “DUMP ALERT! COCKROACHES!”
Reviews.Author: Shann072
Reviews.Content: I booked 10 days of this hotel on Expedia as it looked so wonderful on the web. Don't do it! We left the first night at 3 am. The ceiling was coming off in places, food was left in the freezer, refrigerator falling apart, holes in carpet. The place did not give me a feeling of comfort at all and I did not want to walk without my shoes or socks on. The entire place needs renovating and repair. I was dreading sleeping in the bed as I knew I would not sleep. At 2:30 am, a huge cockroach appeared in the room. That's when I decided we were leaving! I demanded a refund and Expedia spoke with the manager of the hotel to ensure this occurred. Thank God. What a nightmare. I had photos (BUG included) to share but unfortunately, my computer or the web stie were not cooperating in allowing me to share them.

Reviews.Title: “Gross should be shut down.”
Reviews.Author: bujaj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year with my family for 10 days. Lets jus say these days were hell. Dont go here. it reeks of mold. The toilets barely work. The outside had a broken hot tub that smelt like a sewer . I beach was nice but thats about it. I would never ever even bring my pet goldfish on this vactaction. Dont make a mistake and book is. YOU WILL REGRET IT. I prommise that. doesn't even deserve one star.

Reviews.Title: “my stay”
Reviews.Author: Martha H
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Bermuda House. And always will when at daytona. Everyone is very nice there,the room is always great to.We want to move to Daytona soon....Wouldnt mind working and staying at the Bermuda house. cant wait to come back. Martha Howard and Randy Howard

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: elysia1995
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in bedbugmuda it is infested with bed bugs. We couldnt even stay there. My family drove 15 hours to get to daytona and had already payed for this hotel and went to check our beds and they where nasty as heck. We had to sit in there parking lot for a hour tryin to get our money back from expedia then find another hotel. It was terrible. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I have seen worse”
Reviews.Author: mslillulu
Reviews.Content: the location is great. everything you need is across the street you have publix and other stores..... as far as the room they have a bad odor the staff is absolutely wonderful and the pool was just great.... if I ever do stay at the bermuda house again it would not be for the room but it would be for this staff and the pool and a location

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Karen Y
Reviews.Content: My daughter was getting married, Booked our room 1 day too late and had no where to stay. My daughter found Bermuda House and they welcomed US with open arms. Everything we needed the helped us with. All types of stores where across the street so If you had a room with a kitchen you did not have to drive just walk across the street to Publix and shop. Dennys,Walgreens Ruby Tuesday just across the street. The staff was excellent for John who worked front desk for 3 to 11, Misty the housekeeper and Latoya at the front desk was great awell. My family is going back.

Reviews.Title: “This place is in bad need of a bulldozer!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennifers440
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel for 4 nights hoping to have a relaxing, care free, and nice time. What we got was the worse vacation of our lives. We were very disapointed. The smell of the place is overwhelming including the lobby, hallways, elevator, and our room. The room smelled of mold and mildew. The ceiling had water stains all over them assuming the room above had a major leak. There were unidentifiable bugs everywhere including the bed. The carpet looked and smelled like it had never been cleaned, it was horrible and we were litterally scared to take our shoes off. We booked a queen bed and got 2 twins, I guess we were suppose to scoot them together I'm not for sure. The curtain that covered the balcony doors was broke so you could see the outside leaving everybody outside seeing in. Not very comforting to say the least. Upon inspecting the curtain we discovered that the sliding doors to the balcony did not lock this was also not very comforting. Outside directly on the balcony somebody felt that they needed to deposit their gum on the floor. This was not smashed gum but freshly chewed gum leaving us to come to the conclusion that either the cleaning crew did not bother to clean it up or they left it themselves. Either way thumbs down to the cleaning people. The room had a refrigerator and we were happy to see that although we heard it before we actually saw it. I think the people a block away also heard the refrigerator. It had some nice rusty spots decorating it also. I don't think that any of the tile had ever been properly secured to the floor as most them were up and displaced. The bathroom was a whole other story in itself. I have never in my entire life seen a bathroom in a hotel more disgusting than this. Absolutely horrible. There were what appeared to be 2 vents on the ceiling. Both were rusted so bad they were falling out of the ceiling. Ring around the tub, again thumbs down to the cleaning crew. If you were brave enough to actually stay there and shower, which we didn't, the water was black/brown. I am no plumber but I know this is nasty. The walls literally had spit on them. How nasty and disgusting is that? I mean what do the cleaning people actually clean when they go in these rooms? I'm guessing nothing. Not only did our sliding doors not lock the main entrance did not lock either. Feel safe now? After seeing the disaster we had paid for we decide it would be cleaner and safer if we stayed in the car. I called the front desk and told the man that we were going somewhere else and would not be staying there, EVER. The man just says ok. Thats it. He never asked me why. What kind of service is that? I had to go through hotels.com to get a refund, which by the way they were great in helping me. We moved down the street to Georgian Inn (GREAT PLACE). I also have something else to say. I noticed the hotel manager had responded to a few of these complaints saying sorry and that he would address the problem. I also noticed the dates on them and they are pretty wide spread. Sounds like some major changes need to be made before this hotel disapears like the others in Daytona. Maybe better managment and more powerful cleaning tools or something. This is the worse hotel I have ever seen and I would recomend that nobody ever waste any money staying there. You will just be left leaving a bad review like me. You could not have paid me to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: Erin G
Reviews.Content: Here's the letter I wrote to the GM & Sales Manager. I think it speaks for itself. No one should stay here. EVER. I'd like to take a few minutes to let you know just how horrible my stay at the Bermuda House in Daytona Beach, FL 3/14/12-3/17/12 was. I've never been moved to actually complain about accomodations before, always chalking anything negative up to all places have there issues. This time, however, was VERY different. We stayed in Room #117, under the name Kim DeLauri. We were one of 2 couple that booked two rooms. My 1st morning in the shower there was an ant-type bug in the shower with me and it was no big deal~we were in FL and we were on a ground floor. I got out of the shower, went to the counter where the microwave was, and there was another, different type bug. Then, I'm reading on the bed and reach over for my soda on the night stand and there are 2 ROACHES on the nightstand. I LITERALLY turn my head to the left and another ROACH runs across the bedspread. After screaming for my boyfriend to kill them & jumping to pack up everything we have with us immdeiately, we see a 4th ROACH running down the room divider door. Being that it was Daytona Beach during Bike Week, we were VERY aware that there was NOWHERE ELSE to stay for the night, we stayed, WIDE AWAKE, with everything but the sheets on the bed so we could immediately see any bugs that might be there. It was a HORRIBLE, DISGUSTING NIGHT. This, coupled with the DISGUSTING, rusty, filthy conditions of the bathroom and overall dirty public bathroom stench that filled the room are the reasons that I'd NEVER consider even having another conversation about the Bermuda House in Daytona Beach, FL, other than to steer EVERYONE I know away from the disgusting place that it is. I am going to send my complaints to any- and everyone I can to report the conditions, as they are unfit for anything that breathes, other than the staff that keep it running to suck a gutter-worthy level. I am also going to post this review on every site I can as no one should make one penny off of this PIT. It should be demolished & whomever is responsible for it should be ashamed that they allow it to function as it does. Or, better yet, they should be made to stay there themselves. Erin Griffin

Reviews.Title: “Someday You Might Be Old, Too!”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Luc-X
Reviews.Content: One of my riding pals booked this hotel for our trip down to Bike Week in Daytona Beach without having first done due diligence by checking the ratings here at Trip Advisor. When I did the day before we left, I was fairly horrified and with some trepidation (and not wanting to miss Bike Week), I agreed to share a room with him. Both of us went armed. Upon our arrival and afterwards, our fears were both confirmed and dispelled. Basically, this hotel is old and weary and probably beyond the point of being economically refurbishable due to its extensive deterioration from the the heat and humidity... and possibly from neglect. Just imagine trying to replace hundreds of rust stained bath tubs and corroded fixtures Imagine trying to repair thousands of square feet of walls with plaster swollen and cracked from the moisture. Better to tear it down and build a new hotel. So while many of the reviews are pretty accurate - although thankfully we found no bed bugs or other nasty critters, live or dead - there is a positive side to the story. First, the staff was pretty nice and did their very best to make us comfortable. Second, everything worked okay - the water was hot, the door locked when we pushed it hard, the TV worked and the refrigerator kept the beer cold. Third, the swimming pool is probably the best one for miles around - big, 8 feet deep, clean and cold and no one around to keep you from diving. Fourth, there's a Denny's within walking distance if you need more early morning sustenance than a bagel or a muffin, juice and coffee, because the "continental breakfast" is pretty sparse. But the coffee is ready at 7 AM sharp. Fifth, you can walk to the beach and go swimming in the ocean right out back. For a trip like we made, this place was perfectly acceptable and doesn't deserve some of the bad ratings. It's a lot better than sleeping in a campground next to your Harley. For a first trip with you new lady friend or for a honeymoon, it's probably advisable to choose another hotel if you want your relationship to last more than a week. For our purpose, the place was fine... and the pool was great! I have stayed in a wide range of hotels, including some of the very best, all around the globe, including in some third world countries, and... I'd actually stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “SHUT IT DOWN”
Reviews.Author: Laurie H
Reviews.Content: Check in went ok....when my sister and I got to the first room the balcony door was open the room was full of insects...tried to shut the door but it was broken. It would not shut so it would not lock. Not a good feeling being on the 2nd floor. Went to the desk to move rooms and that was not a problem. He moved us to the 3rd floor. No insects in this room and it actually felt and looked a little bigger and cleaner. Nice....that didn't last to long... close to midnight my sister is sleeping and I am watching TV trying to fall asleep when I heard a noise from hallway. I sat up and bed and could see shadows under the door next thing I know someone is trying to get into my room....glad I had the chain on the door....I jumped out of bed and opened the door to see a woman with a key. She was in as much shock as I was. She apoligized and said that they just checked her into the room. Needless to say I called desk gave him some choice words. Spoke with Manager the next morning and he said he would refund one night for me....(Never saw it) so two days go by.. at the beach for the day went up to room for snack when I left the room I noticed that I did not hear the door click when I shut it so I pushed on it and it opened right up. Called the desk and they sent the handy man up. He could not fix it. We had to move again. This time we were on 4th floor with an ocean view. Rest of trip was Ok. I do recommend that you not go into the breakfast room. Smells really bad of sour milk....Pool wasn't that bad only went there on first day as it was windy on the beach...

Reviews.Title: “Not highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: gregory1984
Reviews.Content: The security lock was broken, the pool looks 50 years old, and the floors were sticky. People nice :)

Reviews.Title: “Putting on the Pitz!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JJSJR
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! This has to be one of the worst hotels I have ever encountered...DISGUSTING!!! Sleep in your vehicle, you will be better off! First of all, when I approached the hotel I thought this place needs a face lift, that was definitely evident when I walked in, I would have walked out and found another place, but I found this DUMP on the internet and my charge card was already billed. I asked the Front Desk person where the luggage carts were and he informed me. I ended up making two trips to my rooms as the luggage carts were pitted with rust and I was afraid to touch them. I went into my room an was greeted with this awful odor, which now I believe was mold, I had to spray cologne around the room. After two nights there I started spitting up phlem! I complained to the Front Desk that the bathroom fan would not turn off, so for two nights I had this constant drone, not condusive to sleeping well. There were dried blood stains on the carpet, I would not walk barefoot in the room. The kitchen cabinets had peeling paint and wood missing (termites?). In most of the common areas there is broken and/or cracked windows, the fire estinguishers glass englassed holders are missing. Peeling paint is evident everywhere. The best thing to do with this place is to bulldoze it down!!! I will never stay there again and I am trying to dispute my charges for this DUMP! They had one working ice machine on the first floor and I was on the fourth floor, how convenient!

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back."”
Reviews.Author: richmann47
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and stayed for four days in 7/11. We were very pleased with the services we received. All of the staff there were not only friendly but we feel went out of thier way to accomodate us on our vacation. We would like to send a special thank you to Latoya, a young woman who worked at the front desk. She always has a smile and a kind word. Her professionalism and positive demeanor were outstanding. Thank you, Wayne Ritchie and Susan Mann (Cincinnati, Ohio).

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE....Total dump”
Reviews.Author: Kimdl
Reviews.Content: First, we paid for an ocean front room, but all the balcony doors were nailed shut.. So we were moved to a side view, but not refunded for not having an ocean view. This place is truly a dump! It was nasty, it stank, honestly, we were surprised we didn't catch anything while staying there.

Reviews.Title: “OMG do not stay here "The Bed Bug House"”
Reviews.Author: houndsdj
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I came down for a couple of day's and we booked this place through Delta thinking this is going to be a nice place to stay for the price, we weren't looking for the freaking Ritz or anything like that something decent and by that I mean CLEAN!!! We checked in and stuff and went to the room and could not get the door opened, this cleaning lad saw us trying to get in so she tried with her key and it wouldn't open Finally we got it opened and It was Nasty and the balcony would not lock. So we talked to the front desk lady and she put us in an ocean front room so we were like ok. We went to the room and walked in it was a little bit better so we decided to stay, Well after all that we decided to go out for the evening to eat and shop. We came back around 11 that night and I decided to lay on the bed I fell asleep then I heard my friend start screaming!! she had noticed these bugs jumping on her, then we noticed spiders on the bed so we start looking around then we found a Cockroach. Needless to say we Left did not want to stay in as bug infested Place Nasty!!! Never Ever Again, False Advertizing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “beteer than reveiws”
Reviews.Author: c0achc
Reviews.Content: afterreading some reveiws I was very hesitate to keep my reservation but I am so glad I did. Hotel is right on the beach and the staff went out of its way to make sure that our experince was a good one. I think his name was Mathew help us with what ever he could to finding us some extra dishe to giving my brothers directions to the local scene. This hotel better keep him. Rooms were not the most updated I have seen but were clean and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, never again go by the pictures!”
Reviews.Author: leadbboop
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst I have ever stayed in. When you walked in the lobby you were hit with a smokers lounge smell from the 60's to present, and me even being a smoker of 28 years couldn't stand the stench. The only plus side was that instead of just a frig and micro that we were told it had in the room, it actually had a kitchenette, but the micro had to be unplugged after each use or it would just kick on and beep repeatedly without human touch getting louder and louder, the glass rotating plate on the inside was not even the right one for the micro and sat cockeyed so we had to turn it over to use it therefore it would not rotate since it was not fitted in the slots for rotation. The few pots and dinnerware included would not even pass the goodwill inspection and would of made the trash immediately. There were 3 pots(all scratched to heck and warped), 4 plates/bowls/spoons/forks/knives, a couple glasses, and a coffee maker. The room was filthy, the halls and elevator stunk and were SO filthy. We asked for a simple box of tissue replacement and couldn't even get that (included in the bathroom amenities). The continental breakfast included a muffin, bagel or cornflakes, and juice, reduced fat milk, or coffee...wow, really! The pool was a nice size but the deck chairs were sagging and warped and looked like the dumpster would reject them. The hottub sat empty of water and how about refinishing the deck wood once every oh say 20 years or so?!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sleep”
Reviews.Author: poutababy
Reviews.Content: Before getting to this hotel, I had two other stops with two different hotel stays. This location was by far the best nights rest I got the entire week!. Staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, and the location was quiet. We couldn't use our slider out to the pool this trip as they have signs posted that they are beginning renovations. The hotel is a bit dated but, I think it was well worth the stay. Certainly I can't knock the price since I got the room for $30 a night on one of the travel sites... I'm sure due to renovations going on but, even if I have paid full price here-- I still would write the same good review for this place. I will certainly keep them on my list of places to stay. Continental breakfast was a bit sparse. Seems like there were a lot of people staying their taking a stash back to their rooms so, my last day here-- I got a cup of coffee-- oh, well, Walgreens is directly across the street which is a fabulous benefit. The pool appeared to be clean but, I didn't get a chance to use it. I had an interior room instead of beach front but, the beach was easy to access. It was actually quite windy while we were here and so, really I was glad to have the interior room and didn't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: MJG7992
Reviews.Content: I moved to Daytona Beach from Las Vegas in January and during that month stayed in the Bermuda house twice, for a total of 6 nights. The staff was great, concerned, and did their best to make my stay enjoyable. It was, and I now live in Port Orange, FL, and plan to spend another few days on the beach soon, and will book my stay with them. The price was right, the room was clean. If you want NEW, go elsewhere and pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GABoy63
Reviews.Content: Booked two ocean front rooms, queen beds, via Expedia. Rate was fair. On arrival, learned hotel is under renovation. The glass patio doors for the room balcony have been sealed shut during the renovation. This took away from the reason why I choose this hotel. Expedia did not advertise this fact nor the five dollar parking fee. Rooms are large but old. If you stay in a room on the top floors, allow five to ten minutes for the hot water to reach your piping. The internet signal strength was, well, nonexistent. I had to access the network of the hotel next door. My granddaughter tripped down at the pool. There is a ledge that runs around the edge of the pool and this ledge is not marked. Paramedics were called to check her out. No one from the hotel staff visited or called us about the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised. My kids loved it. I like the atmosphere and the employees.”
Reviews.Author: abcdktown
Reviews.Content: Spent spring break in Daytona last week. Decided to stay one more day. After reading te reviews I was hesitant to stay here. The price was right and I thought it would be ok for a day. I was surprised.. The room was clean. The pool was great. The employees were very nice compared to the hotel I just stayed n for week. The atmosphere was great. More famlies than drunken teenage spring breakers. Our sliding glass doors were sealed shut, however, I noticed they were replacing many of them. It appears they are working to make the repairs. My kids said they would rather stay here next spring break than our usual hotel that cost three times as much.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't expect much, got even less.”
Reviews.Author: robbec1
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews regarding this hotel... on this site, Expedia, and the hotel's site. We decided to be fair and rule out the very best reviews and the very worst, which could be possible reviews written by the hotel itself or by rival hotels. That being said, this was one of the worst hotels we've stayed in. Ever. First off.... The biggest criteria for us was a balcony attached to our oceanfront room, a tiki bar at the pool, and free continental breakfast. This hotel said they had all these things. Bingo! We knew the price was really low ($65.99 a night for 2 queen beds oceanfront with balcony) but figured we could deal with a little rust on the fixtures and older furniture for the location and price. Upon check-in, we were informed that they were undergoing renovations and all balconies in the main tower were screwed shut. Wha? Nothing was mentioned about that on the website. They knew that, but apologized and offered us an oceanview room with a balcony, or our original room with no balcony. We took keys to both and checked them out. The oceanfront room was in the main tower on the 8th (top) floor. The railing outside the room overlooking the pool was very loose. We were traveling with our 14 yr old son and his friend, so we figured this was a disaster waiting to happen and went down to the oceanview room. This was on the 2nd floor with a nice view of the parking lot.... and a balcony door that wouldn't open. It wasn't screwed shut, we just couldn't get it to open, despite the brisk breeze that was blowing in from the missing concrete around the door frame. No thanks to either room. After some checking and double checking by the frontdesk clerk ( Jehmal, I think... he really was very nice) he was able to find us an oceanfront room in the short tower with a working balcony. It was on the 4th floor and was in a great location. So, all is good. For a minute. While checking out the rickety railing over the pool, we noticed the defunct tiki bar. Turns out, they decided it wasn't profitable and closed it. they didn't post that info on the website either. We like to sleep with our balcony door open at night and in the morning the room smelled like urine. I thought for sure someone had an accident. Turns out its the carpet. I don't believe it's ever been changed. Smelled that way every morning. Yuck. The so-called high speed internet was a joke. We couldn't get a decent connection the whole trip. Used our phones for internet instead. The continental breakfast was prepackaged muffins and bagels, or cornflakes... coffee or juice. That was fine, we really didn't expect much more... and the coffee was actually very good. Although, on our last morning the coffee machine broke and was dispensing water only. Our toilet was very slow to flush, you had to hold the handle down for quite sometime to get it to work. The toilet did stop up once and we sent the boys down to notify the clerk (John, I think.... not so nice) and he sent them up with a plunger and told them to make sure to bring it back. We kept it the rest of the stay in case we needed it. Thanks for the help, John. the beds were comfortable, although I doubt they were queens. I am pretty sure they were doubles, but that could have been because we switched rooms. No talk of any refund, but we never asked. The location is nice. There is a mall across the street and it's not far from the boardwalk and shops. ALSO - you will probably be approached on the beach about visiting the timeshare two doors down. DON'T DO IT. They are rude, and liars when it comes to compensation. Tell them to take a hike. We will spend a few extra bucks next time we go to Daytona. This was not worth the savings.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let past reviews deter you...”
Reviews.Author: krimicri
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book a room here for the Daytona 500 based on past reviews, but went ahead and did it anyway. I was very pleasantly surprised and glad that I went with this establishment. It isn't a 5-star hotel, but the room was clean, the beds very comfortable and clean, it looked well kept.. a little aged maybe, but there were obvious signs that upgrades had been made and that an attempt was made to update/improve things overall. The only problem we had with our room was that the patio door wouldn't slide properly and the patio cement was in poor condition, but neither of these was enough to ruin our stay. The continental breakfast was decent, you had your choice of bagels, muffins, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, juice, milk.. We had a great time, an ocean front room, and will definitely keep this place in mind next time we're looking for a place to stay at the beach. Don't let past reviews deter you from checking this place out, you might find that it was just what you were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Icky! Great Potential-some bank should make a big investment and renovate this site.”
Reviews.Author: NACLty
Reviews.Content: Our room was clearly not ready for habitation. The carpet needs replacing. The balcony did not appear safe. The sliding window was difficult to open and the ocean was not visible for all the scum on the window. Their was old dirt everywhere. We expected a clean "motel 6" experience. But it was just too icky. They gave you one fork, and two butter knives, all dirty to cook with. The cooking pot and pan was disgusting. The refrigerator was deplorable; it was sticky with grease and grim all over the door and handle. The stove was the same. Inside the fridge was not clean. This room had not been scrubbed down in months or maybe longer. The concrete on the balcony was so lumpy and too hazardous to walk on; the concrete would become displaced if light pressure was applied. The railing on the balcony was profusely rusted and wobbly--not safe at all. The bathroom was not not clean. The Toilet commode cover did not fit and the toilet ran loudly all night long. When I phoned the house regarding the toilet, they would not even come by to see about it. The cleaning staff made up the beds the next morning and left all trash on the floor--we had to pick up the trash ourselves. To stay we would need to do hard core cleaning. I came on vacation to relax. So we checked out immediately the next morning. We didn't even shower. The good points: It did not smell too much, and the beds were decent. There was a complimentary breakfast of hard stale bagels and delicious moist muffins (I had the muffin) and the coffee was good; however, you couldn't leave the breakfast room, go poolside or take you breakfast to your room. You were forced to eat it in the breakfast room- how inconvenient. The hotel manager was very pleasant. Apparently the hotel is falling upon some hard times. This hotel has great potential. The location is just excellent. The pool looked great. The ocean front view, if the sliding door is opened is wonderful. So much potential! Some bank needs to make a major investment in this one! I might come back after renovations, with the same front desk person (he was very pleasant) and new housekeeping staff and maintenance staff.

Reviews.Title: “double charged and not reimbursed without a fight”
Reviews.Author: DonE1027
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel on a Saturday night (9/18/2010). I left in the morning without a problem. Three days later I noticed I was charged a second night, so I called the resort to give them a chance to redeem the charge. If I were staying two nights the front desk would have charged me for two nights at check-in (obviously). this logic was wasted on the person that tried to help me (she was nice enough but would not give up ANY money). Now I will have to go to my bank and get them to dispute the charge. It would be a good idea to leave this property alone next time you visit Daytona. btw, I am a graduate student in hospitality and tourism. This could be the case study I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: racingnurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bermuda House for the first week in August. Tammy at the front desk was so nice. I was a little skeptical about staying due to reviews I had read, but didn't find any problem. The price was very good, and the room was clean. Everyone was kind and helpful that I encountered. We loved the pool area, it was kept clean and was open later. The only problem that I could find was that the balconies were closed off due to impending renovations. I have family in the Daytona area and we will more than likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Affortable Relaxed Beachfront =Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bblady72
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 day stay @ Bermuda House. Clean and friendly place. Really enjoyed the fact that pool was open until later in the evening as many hotels close their pools early and you only get "To see and not touch"! Close to everything, REALLY steps to beach, short drive to boardwalk.Had a great dinner at the Charlie Horse restaurant right down the street on the recommendation of front desk staff.(Thank you for tip.. food was Excellent!) Breakfast was nothing to brag about, but had coffeepot in room and when I asked for more cups to use, they were gladly given, so made my own (stronger, more to my liking). I was disappointed that balconies are closed, but the fact that I could just walk outside and stand at the beach did help! This was an awesome deal for the money in Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: mankind_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel knowing not to expect too much because we travel quite a bit, and we did not want to spend much money this trip. It was rated the highest for Hotels not charging much for being Ocean front. The woman at the front desk was very pleasant. It was 95 degrees outside, and we notice the hall way and elevator were very warm. Our room was a very good size, and the beds were comfortable. We were told at check in that we would not be able to open the sliders to the balcony, because they were bolted shut for upcoming renovations. We believed them because the Hotel is in bad need of renovation. The room had a stove that looked like it had seen its better days. The remote for the TV didn't work, and the Hotel couldn't supply one that would work. The clock on the night stand didn't work. The AC worked good the first night, but was marginal at best the next night. We were also charged $5.00 per day for parking. On the plus side the room was clean. The location is great. It is right on the beach. Also, the pool and pool area are very nice. The continental breakfast was good for the price we paid. I can't recomend this hotel even with the cheap price, but if you are some one that can put up with what I described then this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, if you can find a deal for under $30/night...”
Reviews.Author: lbshutes
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Bermuda House in Daytona Beach, Florida. I have a few complaints. 1. Check-in time is stated as 3pm. We arrived at 3:45 and we able to check-in but were told no clean rooms were available. We waited until 7pm before actually being assigned a room. I fear it may have been longer if we hadn't returned and sat in the lobby for the last hour before getting the room... 2. One selling point to this hotel was the balcony access for every room. The hotel is "doing renovations" and has closed off all sliding doors. No room can access their balcony. I think this is something we should have been made aware of prior to our arrival. The front desk stated that it would be about 1 year to finish the work (as of 7-23-10). 3. We checked in Friday night. It is now Sunday morning. The room is just now getting to a comfortable temperature. We have basically sealed off the room to allow the somewhat functioning a/c to work. Therefore housekeeping can not come in, as that would only allow all the "cool" air out. 4. Our mini-fridge does not seal, and can not keep anything cold. The toilet constantly runs. And the room reeks! I don't just mean a slight odor. It smells, bad! Thankfully there is a PUBLIX across the street with a wide selection of odor neutralizers/air fresheners. 5. There is no poolside Tiki Bar, as listed on the hotel features, per Hotel.com's website. That's really no big deal, but just another thing to point out. 6. Breakfast consists of either a bagel or muffin, coffee, O.J. or apple juice. It gets the job done, but not as expansive as you would normally expect. 7. There are ice machines on every other floor, but they never have ice. Further examination of the units showed the air intake filters appear to have gone unkept in quite some time. No wonder the units are so loud! 8. They keep the outside access doors open at all times. (No surprise the rooms can't cool down.) And even allow a cat free roam of the building, with pet food dishes scattered about. This isn't a guest's... Just some stray. All the complaining aside, this is a hotel worth staying at if you can find it for say $30/night. The views are amazing. It is right across the street from a shopping center, housing everything you may need. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. You can walk out on the beach and see the fireworks they display every Saturday night at 9:45 from the pier (2 miles south, along the boardwalk). And the staff! They are so nice and helpful, doing whatever they can within their powers to make you comfortable. I have only dealt with Tammy and Tiffany at the front desk so far, but I give them pats on the back for handling the customers and issues as well as they do. They really go out of their way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: fortpierce
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had the best of both worlds--hotel is right on the beach, but has a great pool and sundeck area. Our room faced the ocean, we enjoyed waking up to the beautiful sunrise and seeing the dolphins swiming by. We appreciated the free continental breakfast and the in-room microwave and refrigerator. Kids had plenty of snaks and drinks on hand. Tons of fun our family. We will do this again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: leadman1
Reviews.Content: Quite a pleasant experience. The hotel is old , but reasonably clean with very pleasant and helpful staff. The beds were comfortable. Very convenient to the beach. My wife was very satisfied,and she's not easy to please. We had trouble with the door lock , which we turned in so they could fix. No it's not the Hilton , but it was a decent ,affordable place to stay that we will be going back to.

Reviews.Title: “A night by the ocean”
Reviews.Author: Driver21225
Reviews.Content: Nice place. very nice and fast employees. free breakfast (muffins and cereal). great pool more for adults becuse deep. walk around to the back and your on the beach go out the side and your in the pool. down side water controls in shower hot water only. tiki bar closed at pool and hot tub out of order. Ruby Tuesdays Restaurant and shopping center directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Run unless you like mold, mildew & filthy bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: les41675
Reviews.Content: NOT as pet-friendly as they confirmed on the phone. Upon arrival, the desk clerk informed me that he was not aware of the pet & I would have to be downgraded from a 1st floor poolside room to a "pet-friendly" room. I was also instructed that they were never to be left in the room alone. (Thats a little difficult when dogs are not allowed on the beach) After inspecting the room because the smell, I discovered a bathroom with a toilet so filthy, the pvc pipes under the sink were black w/mold as well as the tub & shower tiles. The cabinets under the kitchen sink were warped & again covered in black mold. I gave Bermuda House the benefit of my doubt & asked to see another pet-friendly room. I was given the key to a handicap room w/urine running down the toilet. I checked out immediately & politely asked for a refund. When the clerk asked my why he tried to argue w/me until I showed him the pics I took on my phone. I was told my credit card had been refunded but a month later American Express is still desputing the charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamcaos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bermuda House during the Coke 400 - hotel itself is a typical daytona beach hotel, when your are at the beach you shouldn't be laying around your room anyway..beds were clean, sheets were clean, bathroom had a little deep mold on tile, a/c didn't get quite cool enough, but the staff more than made up for any short comings in the room. We were very happy and would stay again, simply because of the staff...thanks for a great stay..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and Very Misleading”
Reviews.Author: detbrnis
Reviews.Content: A true let down. Not only will I never stay here again I will not recommend this place to anyone. Upon checking in, two desk clerks and one other customer besides myself. The desk clerk acted as though she didn’t even want to assist me and being pleasant was sure lacking. Once checked in, which I would have canceled upon entry if I wouldn’t have lost $336.00, the elevator was full of water without any caution signs, which my son slipped getting onto the elevator, flooring in hallway uneven due to tile breakage. Back door entrance to our hallway was full of water and sand from the beach, there was a sign, laying down further down the hallway. Where is housekeeping? The room had a musty smell, thank goodness I carried Febreeze with us. Every piece of room hardware was very rusty throughout the whole room, bugs on the bathroom ceiling like someone sprayed and didn’t clean up afterward. Tissue holder falling off the wall, toilet seat loose and falling off as well, not even property fitted. The bathroom fan did not work and the exhaust was full of dust and flea looking bugs (pictures). Water damage on ceiling from room above and popcorn ceiling falling. Apparent quick fix cosmetic repairs visible throughout the room. Cats, yes, cats running around the so-called dining area for a continental breakfast lacking substance. Cats are apparently permanent guests without complaints as they had their food and water bowls near the dining entrance. When asked about the special theme park admission booked through Hotels.com and offered by the hotel, the front desk staff knew nothing of such and couldn’t assist. Hotels.com indicated they only post the information as what the hotel gives them. Very Very disappointed. Not only will I NOT stay here again, I would not recommend this place to anyone. Not only posting here but will post throughout every site I can find, including social sites, such as Facebook, myspace, and twitter. I only wish I could post more pictures to show truth. Seemingly not worth the $336.00 it costs to stay here for sporting event.

Reviews.Title: “We Had A Great Experience At the Bermuda House”
Reviews.Author: ThwDawg
Reviews.Content: I looked at motels for weeks before booking at the Bermuda House. We wanted to stay on the beach and also be able to bring our family pet. We needed two rooms .... our kids are 18 and 22 now so we really had to look for the best prices because of having to pay for both rooms. I was worried the prices were so low that it might be awful.... so I said if we get there and hate it we can go to another hotel but everyone will be in the same room. We arrived 3 hours BEFORE check in ... our rooms were not ready which we were not expecting them to be but ... they offered 2 other rooms that were ready both were pool side. We had booked and prepaid for oceanfront rooms for 4 nights. They offered us: no charge on a pet fee, no charge for the in room safe in both rooms, and no charge for the daily parking. We thought that was extremely nice that they offered us anything at all because we were 3 hours before check in so we took it. By them offering to let us have other rooms we got to spend the day on the beach and in the sun. We were checked in, unpacked and on the beach by 1:00. Everyone was extremely nice and friendly at the front desk. Like previous reviews it is an older building and can definitely use some work. But we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were big, the kitchen was perfect and also came with plates, silverware, glasses...etc. Housekeeping was very friendly also. We honestly have no complaints at all. I know others have said the air conditioning didnt work but we did not experience that problem in either of the rooms. You get what you pay for but for us we thought we got more than we paid for. This was our experience and we will stay here again when come to Daytona. Rooms 106 and 108

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised! Not as bad as we were anticipating after reading comments!”
Reviews.Author: austinsmom01
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I was a little worried given some of the comments listed here. But we got a great price through expedia and went for it. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. Yes, the hotel is older and has suffered a little damage from time and storms but overall it was a great place to stay. The staff at the front desk were extremely helpful and VERY friendly! If you give kindness you get kindness in return. We had an oceanfront room with a balcony and kitchette and it couldn't have suited our needs better. Ok so it wasn't a majestic palace but it wasn't bad AT ALL! The pool was extremely large and the pool area was clean. The kids enjoyed it VERY much! The tiki bar wasn't much to speak of but we mixed our own drinks in the room and enjoyed them at the pool (in styrofoam cups) and nothing was said. I'd recommend bringing your own beach and pool towels as they were never stocked but that didn't bother us because we came prepared!! The continential breakfast was adequate for us as well. Cereal, bagels, small danish, muffins, oatmeal, grits, juice, milk, coffee. Beach access was easy and convenient. Some of the comments here are people just being extremely picky over silly things. Some people are NEVER happy. For our two nights to come enjoy the beach it was a WONDERFUL place to stay and we will definitely come back here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Great Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: haileybell07
Reviews.Content: Ok we have been here since June 21 and are staying through the 27th. This is a very nice place to stay. Yes the building needs a litlle work but the rooms are very accomdating. Very nice beds. The room does not stink at all. The staff has been more than helpful and are always friendly. If you need something in your room, just call the front desk and they send it right up. We will DEFINATLY stay here again next year. Thank you to all the staff for your kindness. room 428.....

Reviews.Title: “I hated this place...”
Reviews.Author: Nicole W
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Bremuda House feb.!6-21 It was the worst hotel we had ever stayed at.. It started with the tub that leaked everywhere in our room so our floor was soaked all the time there were not enough dishes in our room our oven didnt work right.. The sliding door wouldnt open.. We could not get any wireless connection on our computer... Not enough hot water... Breakfast not stocked properly... were told this was only room and couldnt switch rooms...The pictures were nothing like the room on hotwire where we booked our trip... Then when we were leaving for our early morning flight the man at desk was rude a drunk guest was bothering me and he just sat there and said nothing... We have never been treated so poorly ever.......

Reviews.Title: “Very mislead hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazyhair46
Reviews.Content: We where very very disappointed , You go on vacation and expect to have a nice place to stay. I expect to see when I get there what I seen on the website, I trust people and businesses to be honest , This place needs tons of work, The workers where very nice. Never was told that we had to pay 5.00 a day for parking and then a sign in parking lot that they r not responsible for anything stolen. But excuse me is that why I'm paying you to secure my car. There was spaces u couldn't park because the building is falling off from the top. There is no lights in the parking lot you can't see when your walking to your car. They want you to pay to use the safe in the room but u have no choose to use it because your main door can be pushed open. The loungers around the pool which was suppose to be along the ocean side and is not need to be all replaced gross. Hot Tub roped off can't use it. No Tiki Bar there is 3 Beat up ripped up chairs by some portable gross looking thing. Nothing set up for drinking. Maybe someone should be shown what a Tiki Bar is. There where pets everywhere even a cat walking the front counter when we checked in gross i"m allergic to cat's. Then the cat was eating off a plate in the breakfast room hallway. I would never eat in the breakfast room just didn't seem clean. Carpet needs to be all replaced. The main doors to your room has some latch that doesn't even match up to hook it. Our patio door was so gross and the lock didn't work and they had a rod u put in to keep the door close and I don't think it has been vacuum since they open where you put the rod. In a nut shell it needs to be all re done But the worker's all where very nice and try to do what they could under the situation. Bottom line if you owe a business it's your responsibility to keep it maintain. I have learned a big lesson I will check the room before I check in. Our friends where also so disappointed. The price was good but it is reg. 135.00 for oceanfront There is no room there worth that. The beach area is very nice and the view from the room Oceanside is very nice. I feel like I wish I could redo that part of my vacation over and be in a nice Hotel. I tell everyone do not stay there unless it is all redone. Please take off your photo's and put on the real photo's of what it really looks and not what it looked like when you first open. Unsatisfied customer in Wisconsin Th

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel and staff especially front desk I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Joe3617
Reviews.Content: Starting with Check in @ 3:00pm, NO NOT REALLY, try 5:30pm. Let's say that would be all I would not mind, but while we waited at the pool we saw several of the staff that was suppose to be cleaning or getting our room ready, drunk or on something but not in their 5 senses. OK let that go, but after we got our room, the door did not lock, the air condition did not work and the room smelled awful. We called front desk and "Tiffany" or girl at front said "there is nothing they could do and if we didn't like it, It's not like we were going to go anywhere since we had already booked in and payed for our stay. Needless to say we left. We lost some money for that night but we slept very good in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean - yes. Othewise, you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: PICKY502
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Bermuda House on Daytona Beach June 9 – 15, 2010. The room was described as an ocean view room with two queen beds. The description on Expedia says there is a poolside tiki bar, an oceanfront pool, a children’s wading pool, and a complimentary Continental breakfast. They also offer wi-fi, kitchenettes, and balconies with pool or ocean view. The room amenities also state that there are cribs/infant beds available. The poolside tiki bar and the hot tub were both closed. I saw a white board that mentioned drinks. But, there was absolutely no lounge/bar anywhere in site. The hot tub was roped off and did not appear to be in any process of re-opening. The children’s wading pool was nice. It was basically a circular pool of about 1 foot depth. The complimentary breakfast was cereal, cold muffins, cold danishes, and bagels. There was a shortage each day of the danishes. But, it was free food. So, that was good. Our room had a microwave, fridge, sink, dishes, and utensils. We did not have any way to close the sink in the bathroom or kitchenette for shaving or dishes. When I asked about a crib, I was told they did not have them. The Expedia site also mentions a surcharge for parking. However, under the fee’s section it is not listed as a $5 parking fee nightly. That seemed to catch people off guard when they arrived. I heard a lot of grumbling at the pool about the $5 a day fee to park. The pool was certainly not beachside or oceanfront. The pool is separated from the beach with hotel rooms. So, there is no way to see the beach from the hotel. There is a shade on the pool for the first part of the day due to the eight or so stories of hotel rooms separating the pool from the beach. So, for sun tanners that like the pool, this may pose a problem. On the upside; it was a hotel that I paid around $60 a night for. The housekeeping was pretty good. There was a man and woman doing the housekeeping and they did an excellent job. One day a younger lady came in and she did not replace the toilet paper or tissues. I saw many on staff doing cleaning jobs such as cleaning rooms, mopping floors, emptying trash, etc. They were all needed and were busy doing a good job. I thought the hotel was overall pretty clean. We are used to staying in more expensive condos. In comparison, this hotel needs some work. The door lock on our room #307 was enlarged from abuse. There was a lot of rust throughout the building. The rope to the pool kept coming loose because it had been duck taped into the metal holder. The pool decking was painted. The concrete and paint were both chipping. The carpet appeared old; but, was not in disarray. There was a smell of mold and old throughout the hotel. Although it was clean. It just smelled. The bathrooms down by the pool were absolutely disgusting. I saw several people in there on different days spraying to try and fix the smell. But, it was over powering to just walk in. It smelled of urine. Although, it appeared clean too. Overall, this was a staff-friendly place with clean rooms and cheap prices. This hotel is located between the Playa and the Daytona Conference Center. Both hotels looked much nicer. The beach was nice and flat. There is driving on the beach behind this hotel. I didn’t see much traffic; maybe one or two cars every few minutes. We have been to Siesta Key, Destin, Panama City, the Keys, Ft Meyers, and Sanibel. We love Florida and love finding good places to eat and have fun. I’m not much into a carnival atmosphere and I found Daytona Beach to be just that. For something to do, we took an evening and went to the Ponce de Leon light house. That was a nice drive. They end tours before we got there though. So, we did not get to go out and see the buildings and light house up close. We went to several restaurants. Kerr’s Winghouse at the Boardwalk was good food. It’s a Hooters atmosphere. The boardwalk beside Wyndham and Hilton was very nice. They have concerts on Saturday (bring a chair). It’s also just a pretty place to take pictures. We also went to Joes Deck & Grill. It was a bit of a drive (about ½ way between the hotel and the light house). But, this was probably our best restaurant that we ate at. It is located on a pier. We saw a sting ray and a barracuda while we ate. I had the BLT (about $4). It was good. We also had shark bites. Although they aren’t made of shark ~ so that was misleading. But, they were good too. If we go back again, I will check out the Wyndham and Hilton. I also liked the pool at the Daytona Conference Center and all the goings on at Grand Seas Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Each year we stay there - it gets better and better!! Tons of fun in the sun!!”
Reviews.Author: maggs02
Reviews.Content: Laytoya was awesome to work with. The Staff was very accomodating to our large and active crowd.. Many nice repairs. Fantastic support from all staff members, cleaning crew were great. Tom Peets was very professional and helpful to us. affordable. Could use some new carpet in room 101 and new kitchen floor! Laytoya promissed us great weather months in advance and she was 100% correct! Thank you Laytoya for putting up with us all! We will be back for our 4th year next year!!

Reviews.Title: “So not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: southerngirl19
Reviews.Content: Okay, my husband and I traveled to Daytona for our anniversary a few weeks ago and decided to book the Bermuda House for our stay because it always looked nice (from the street) other times we'd been there. Boy were we wrong! There was a HUGE line at check in at 3:00, which didn't bother me until I realized that the line was due to the fact that EVERYONE'S reservations were messed up in some way. Some people's were lost, others had incorrect bedding, or other problems. I was, however, pleased after my checkin went smoothly and quickly...until getting to our room. The room appeared nice and clean on the inside, but after being in the room for about 5 minutes unloading, I heard something at the door. As I walked over to open the door and see what it was, the door opened before I reached it and another lady who was in the checkin line near me was standing there with her family. They had given us the same room! So, we both went back downstairs, cut in line (because everyone remembered that we were just there), and tried to straighten everything out. The MANAGER didn't see this as a problem and promptly told me that I should always flip the bar lock over so that no one can get in, even with a key. My response was: well, I understand that, but if we had been down at the beach, they could've easily come in (because it is impossible to use that lock when out of the room) and stolen our things, for all we know. He didn't see that as an issue at all and said that the checkin staff would fix the problem. I was NEVER offered anything for my trouble, but requested having my parking taken care of for the weekend, which they did. Now for the room and cleanliness. The room appeared very clean and nice, but there is no DVD player or anything. If you want to watch anything, it has to be on TV. The beach in front of the place is nice, but the balcony we had was just plan SCARY! We were 7 floors up, which I would normally love, but the balcony floor looked as though an earthquake had hit it - it was cracked and some of it was bubbled up like someone tried to push something up through it from underneath. The ceiling of the balcony was also peeling and dripping something, so we never could sit on the balcony that we paid the oceanfront price for! The pool itself was nice and large; however, the lounge chairs were dirty, and I wouldn't have sat my things on them and especially wouldn't have sat on them myself. The hot tub also wasn't usable and was roped off, so we didn't get to use it. It was nice to have continental breakfast each day, but don't expect more than cereal, danishes, and fruit. Nice for a small breakfast, but not filling at all. Overall, my husband and I feel that the maid is the only staff member really doing her job here, and we WILL NOT be staying at the Bermuda House again!

Reviews.Title: “Makes you want to shower in the ocean”
Reviews.Author: traveler429
Reviews.Content: This was a Freebee that I had received ( thank god I didn't Pay for it myself!) The staff was rude and the “hotel” had no circulation and my family and I were breathing musty air. I didn’t trust the elevators. They sounded like they were going to break down. No cooling inside either. The rooms had broken tile and a grimy “kitchen” I didn’t feel comfortable sleeping in the bed because it looked dirty. I kept my socks on the entire time. Wouldn’t take my family downstairs for breakfast because I could only imagine what their kitchen would look like. Instead we drove down the street to the HILTON RESORT and had breakfast in a clean, elegant, dining area with a beautiful view of the property and the ocean. Skip this one and find another place. Don’t put your family in danger. Pool didn’t look safe either.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for extra chages on your credit card”
Reviews.Author: reinlaagland
Reviews.Content: I checked out the 26th of march and asked if any additional chrges, office person said no. a month later ther was addition al $50.00 for parking and safe use wich i never used and i have never paid for parking at any Daytona hotel in 16 years of going there.I tried to clear up with the hotel manager and was told they would not refund because somewhere in the lobby there is sign stating about parking. All corrispondance with them it was talked about a parking fee. this is not a great hotel just a place to shower and sleep and it pretty bad they go to these extreme to chinz a extra $50.00 out of a customer. I will NEVER come back

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Michigander2010
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous after reading the reviews, but we were plesantly surprised. The rooms were clean,the view was awesome and the kids loved the pool. Every staff memeber that we came across went out of their way to make us feel welcome and ask if we needed anything. It was quiet at night and the beach area was very clean. We had four teenagers traveling with us and I never heard one complaint the whole time we were there. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ariel1976
Reviews.Content: Hotel is being renovated. Staff friendly and beach is wonderful...Great location if you want to be away from the hustle and bussel of Daytona Beach...Pool very clean room cleaned daily and is dated but clean. Hot tub is out of service. Shopping across the street...Internet is poor had to move all around hotel for it to work...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Very clean and staff were very friendly :)”
Reviews.Author: lissa02
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the bermuda house with my 2 sisters and dad for spring break. The staff were very nice and friendly. The room service did their job on time. The pool was clean as well has the breakfast room. We enjoyed the oceanview from our room. Great shopping across the street as well as restaurants...we will definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place.”
Reviews.Author: momx4tn
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Bermuda House for almost seven years, and we usually rent 5 or 6 rooms. We love the location and the price. Yeah, there are better places which you wil pay for, but the beach is the main attraction for us. We use our rooms to sleep in and with the views, location, and price, you can't beat it. Coming down for bike week 2010, and vacation 2010 and bringing more people. momx4tn, chattanooga, TN

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Right on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: d123Tampa_FL
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here and the place was great. The room was very comfortable, it was equipped with a stove, kitchen sink, and refrigerator. There was a great view from the pool area from our balcony. The hotel is conveniently located right on the beach. There is also a grocery store, shopping plaza, and restaurants located very close by the hotel. This was definitely a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Little less than expected”
Reviews.Author: kathih814
Reviews.Content: The room itself was nice. One problem not so significant was that there were no hangers in the closet. The biggest disappointment was that we planned on a balcony to sit out on. We were on the first floor with sliding glass doors that were not abel to be opened. If we wanted to go outside we would have to leave our room, walk around the building and get a couple of chairs from the pool area. It looked as though every other floor had a balcony to go out on from your room. They did waive our parking fee of $16 because of this inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Advisor106
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in Daytona Beach, check out the Bermuda House. It is very well situated and have a direct access to the beach. Perfect for those who like to take long walks. The room was quite large and had a microwave and a refrigerator. The room was promptly done every morning. Very quiet so we had a good rest each night. Near restaurants and shopping plaza. What more do you need.

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: PPowell6
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel thru Priceline, and after I knew where I was staying I went to see the reviews and read all the horrible experiences that people had here, so I was very apprehensive going there. When I got there the hotel sign said, "Check our Rats" . I was thinking what nightmare did I get myself in. I told my concerns to the desk clerk and he assured me it was not a luxury hotel but was just a basic place to stay but if I had an issue to let me know and they would work with me. It was 10pm when I got there, and when I went to the room for the first time, to check it out, I didnt even take my suitcase to see for myself what I was getting into to. I walked in and looked around, I noticed it was out dated, but it looked clean. I stayed for 5 nights and never saw anything to make me think it was not clean, just out dated. The shower was hot and lots of pressure every morning, clean towels, and room always looked freshened up when I went back every night. I had a beautiful view of the beach and everyone was as nice as could be. If your looking for no thrills place to sleep and a hot shower, this is the place. I never saw the breakfast they had as a Starbucks is across the street and went there each morning. There are lots of restaurants very close. The free internet worked most of the time, but had to reconnect it many times. It had a kitchen and a pool but never used either. Would I go back? Probably if I were by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: iceangel511
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay and they are pet friendly. The view was beautiful, being right on the beach and It was close to restaurants and shopping. Very convienient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: mitzi32009
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Bermuda House for just a wek-end away from home. I found the room to be clean, beds to be comfortable and ocean view amazing. The kichenette was well stocked and really all I had to bring was the food! The contential breakfast was excellant! Although the weather was bad, our room and stay was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: joyce1943
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bermuda House, this motel is not the newest or the fanciest motel in Daytona Beach but the rooms are clean and the service is very good, we enjoyed our room because it had a balcony and we were able to sit and enjoy the sun from morning to night.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, Friendly Staff but Hotel Needs Lots of Work”
Reviews.Author: pickle1998
Reviews.Content: The first room was clean, but bath tub extremely dirty and tattered, balcony door would not open and a closet and cabinet door missing. Requested & received 2nd room which was clean, but in need of repairs. The iron & a couple of lights did not work. The microwave was sitting on top of the refrigerator & did not have a class plate. The shower had low water pressure & was cold at times. The commode did not flush completely & required a second flushing. The room was very drafty & made a lot of noise during windy conditions. The balcony was not clean & looked a bit unsafe. The pool area, breakfast room and lobby looked nice. The linens were clean, but the pillows were very uncomfortable. The cleaning staff & front desk staff were very nice. Does have free internet, but must give credit card info to access. Could never get to work. Would be a good hotel if not for all the needed repairs. In present state I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Looks are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: nascargal88
Reviews.Content: While recently staying at the Bermuda House started out very nice. The room looked great it was clean and the lobby looked nice. But as the night went on there were cracks in the grout of the tile in the bathroom that let little bugs/roaches into the room. There was a little raoch in the bed. I was charged $25 pet fee and had to sign a pet policy that suggest you put sheets on the floor for my pet to walk on. But my pet was way cleaner then this room turned out to be. After the night of killing little bugs at 8am the maintence man was hammering nails into walls 2 doors down from our room. When calling the front desk they were not helpful and calling the manager didn't do any good at all. He ignored the fact that the maintence guy was hammering at 8am. And when told about the bugs all he said was he checks the rooms and has never seen bugs. But he must not have ever stayed in a room for a night. I will never ever stay at this hotel again! I frequently go to Daytona, thought I would try something new. Big mistake!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal On Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: SharpInsight
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good deal and had lots of great amenities, such as a full-scale refrigerator, oven & stove-top, microwave, pots & pans, dishes & silverware. We saved money by making our meals in the room. We had a room on the 8th floor that faced the ocean with a nice view, and although it was a winter's day, the breeze coming off the water was pleasant. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, and the television supplied a fair share of cable channels. We were told because the room was on a high floor, we might have to wait some time to get hot water for the shower, but we never experienced that problem, thankfully. Although the hotel advertised free high-speed internet, we were unable to connect the night we stayed. Oh, and the $5.00 parking fee is just nickeling and diming you. The hotel was very empty, perhaps due to the fact that it was both the off-season, and folks didn't have as much money to travel this holiday season. All in all though, if you are looking for an inexpensive, very adequate accommodations right off the beach for a day or two this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: wgoldberg1
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful service personnel. Dated but clean and comfortable rooms. Located directly on the ocean with a nice beach. Heated pool in an inside protected court. Reasonably priced but an extra $5.00 charge for parking in an unprotected lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great service”
Reviews.Author: butterflyjoy
Reviews.Content: This stay is the third time that my husband and I have stayed at the Bermuda House. Everytime has been a pleasant experience. The value that you get is also great. We will return there many more times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lyn402
Reviews.Content: The hotel room felt like home. I enjoyed the ementities like the refrig, stove etc... the customer service was great. I would surely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Your people make a difference”
Reviews.Author: spanky8458
Reviews.Content: We had a messed up Va-Cation and the people that worked the desk Daniel & LaToya made it so much better. I would come back, for being an older building you felt very good, the building was very clean and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and a fair price!”
Reviews.Author: razorfish355
Reviews.Content: I think some people who are giving this place a negative review are expecting Caesar's Palace or Wynn in Las Vegas. This place is neither. True, the hotel is older, but this does not mean it is not clean. In fact, the sheets were clean, the room was clean, and the location could not be beat. Desk help was efficient and kind, breakfast got the job done, and the pool was outdoor and heated (I passed on this since I neglected to bring a bathing suit). If I were to have any complaints, it had to do with getting the water hot in the shower. It took quite awhile, but for the price my wife and I would certainly stay here again. The room gave us a lovely beach view of the sunrise and was located across the street from Bellair Plaza and close enough to Outback Steakhouse, TGIFriday's, and Quizno's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Barefooting Inn-like accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Louie48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The price and the location were great. The hotel is directly across from a mall that has a buffet style restaurant, Publix, Bealles outlet, etc. It is a nice walk to the Denny's (one block away) and Olive Garden (5 blocks away). For those souls who do not want to brave the drive from snowy Canada, through the mountains, it would be possible to fly to Orlando, then catch the DOT busline from Orlando Airport to the Daytona area. No Car Needed. As I said earlier the price is right. If you are picky, and like perfection, this hotel may not be for you.... go to the Hilton for 400$ a night, otherwise, take of your shoes, and enjoy the barefooting atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “wondeful”
Reviews.Author: kinkyb07
Reviews.Content: my stay at the bermuda house was very pleasing the rates where reasonable adn the morning view was spectatular

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: apjp123
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an average hotel for a cheap rate, then this is definitely the place to stay. The hotel needed renovating, but other than being a little out dated, we had no complaints. The room even ended up being cheaper than we were quoted when we booked it. It was also a good location. On the strip, good places within walking distance, and situated between Daytona Beach & Ormond Beach. Definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Pre-Wedding Room”
Reviews.Author: Jewel2yrs
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, my husband and I needed a hotel steps away from the beach. The room was clean with fridge, mic and sink to clean. The sheets were clean and white and the rugs were great. They have continental breakfast in the dining room that is very cozy. The staff helped my husband and I get ready for the wedding and even let us stay 2 hours past check out time. Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “delightful daytona beach”
Reviews.Author: samourkitty
Reviews.Content: we have always enjoy our stay at the bermuda house. different this time. front desk clerk not very friendly. asked for a ocean front on second floor none a available or needed to be clean. a room was available on the sixth room. which i wasn't to happy about. but it was ok. found a long hair on the tub. toilet felt like it was going to fall. rest of the rooms ok. would i stay there again, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - old hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: carsfords
Reviews.Content: We stayed in your hotel this past weekend for the Turkey Rod Run and were very disappointed for the accomodations that we had for the price we paid. The rooms are old, carpeting disgusting and the cleaning was lacking. The maid only changed the towels and cleaned nothing. We paid $140+ per night for two rooms that were not even worth payng $40 per night. I will not recommend your hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: jsprh
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this motel for several years now over the thanksgiving holiday because proximity to an event we attend. However never again. The place has disintegrated over the years to the point of being uninhabitable. Of our 6 rooms booked together....three had ants in the beds, two had black mold growing all over the room,all had nasty carpets, All the balcanies were sealed off .. because they were about to crumble off the side of the building. One couple in our party had to be moved three times due to disgusting rooms. We booked these rooms 6 months in advance so that we could be placed together ,but we were on four different floors. Sadly I think this one is going the way of alot of motels in daytona..the bulldozer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: Retired65Ottawa
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Bermuda House Hotel in Mid November (15th to 21st) and we would recommend this Hotel. The Staff were very friendly and extreemly helpful. The Hotel is right on the Beach, has a great Pool and is also right across the street from a Shopping Center that has Restaurants, Grocery Store and Assorted Stores. The Hotel was reasonably priced and close to all Daytona Beach attractions and activities. Many of the rooms are efficiencies so you have a Fridge, Stove, Microwave and Sink. We found this very convienient and allowed us to have some meals at the Hotel. The Hotel also provides a very nice Free Continental Breakfast in a Bright, Cheerful Room. We met several Guests who have been coming to this hotel for several years and they said they always enjoyed it. The only negative was that they charge a $5 per day fee for parking so you have to add that to the rate charged for the room. We had not had that charged at any other Hotels on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “ocean view was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: theemerald
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for the business we had in Daytona Beach. The staff was very attentive to all our needs and Bermuda House was very easy to find. I had never been to Daytona Beach and was thrilled to see the Daytona Raceway which was not very far from the Bermuda House.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mspowderpuff
Reviews.Content: Second time at this hotel and saw improvements since last year. Price is EXTREMELY low. Will stay at the Bermuda House again next year for the Daytona Magic Convention held next door. Those rooms are way over priced compared to these.

Reviews.Title: “They MUST falsify their rating!”
Reviews.Author: JeffProvidenceRI
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you, this place is AWFUL. I travel 100 nights per year on business and I can put up with a lot but this place was the pits. There was a boarded up restaurant in the front lot. The halls featured torn carpet and plaster repairs of a different color. The room was dark, with broken tiles, rusted appliances and an unkempt bed. The bathroom was dingy with broken tiles and a chipped sink. It was inhabited by a small army of fleas. It was midnight but we could not even spend a single night there. We checked out within 20 minutes of arrival and happily paid 300% more at a national chain down the street. The front desk at the national chain told me that they get similar refugees from the Bermuda House on a regular basis. This place might be fine for kids on Spring Break but otherwise spend $20 more and get a room that does not leave you scratching.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Pilot89
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Daytona Beach and stayed at the Bermuda House for 5 nights. It was the best and Least expensive vacation we ever had. I would highly suggest you do the same. While it is older, it had very important things it offered. Ice cold air conditioning, very comfortable beds, very nice kitchenette. with large refrigerator, Hot showers and just very comfortable. Very nice pool and on a beautiful part of daytona beach. Awalkers paradise. We' looked at other places while we were there and I didn't find anywhere else I'd rather stay. The staff and management company were the best and most accomodating. We'll definatedly be back.
