Reviews.Title: “Improving with new management”
Reviews.Author: pelliott1020
Reviews.Content: Very good staff. This building is being turned around. All new bedding was appreciated. Our room had the extra kitchen that was in good order. The bathroom was very old. The ceiling fan did not work. The entrance, lobby and breakfast room were recently remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach Vacation 2009”
Reviews.Author: JThompson2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brumuda for 1 night and the room was pretty nice, the only thing we were not happy with was the cleanleness of the bathroom and the parking lot view we received for the location of the room. We always brought our small dog on the trip and they didnt have very rooms to choose from with an animal. My recommedation would be make the selection of rooms that animals are allowed in a little larger with better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain with flaws”
Reviews.Author: davesnothere
Reviews.Content: We usually stay there because of the price, it is also family oriented. I think it used to be a Ramada, You have access to the Playa next door which has a Tiki Bar, nice pool and comedy club upstairs. The rooms are clean, but we stayed in 525 and it was in need of repair (the balcony paint was chipping off the roof. We usually pay about $79 off season to stay there and get an ocean view, about 40% less expensive than nearby ones. It has a kitchenette, free continental breakfast and direct ocean views. One drawback, they nick you for an extra $5 per night for parking. Why not just add it in the room price? It is a point of aggrevation for the staff and guests. Check your bill as I am always charged for a room safe and never request or use it. The staff is good about adjusting these bogus charges. Overall it is the best value I have found in the Ormond Beach area, if they would just take out the hassles it would be great.

Reviews.Title: “very peacefull”
Reviews.Author: rob1daguilar
Reviews.Content: It was very peacefull and great service. The location was excellent, all kinds of stores near by. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing, quite and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: trvlcpl13
Reviews.Content: A very pet friendly hotel with a great staff. From the management to the maintenance personnel every one was very polite and helpful. The rooms are clean and well stocked. The property is directly across the street from a well diverse plaza with food and shopping, a great location for the kids and family. We will stay here again that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: flabumWinterhavenFl_
Reviews.Content: when we got to the hotel the general manager saw us park in a handicap spot. he came out and helped my wife with the luggage and pushed the cart in for us. he was very friendly as was the desk person who handled himself in a vert friendly way. we stayed for 2 days and were pleased with the room.after we were settled in the room the desk called to make sure we were happy and everything was to our liking. we were very pleased with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Manager Tried...”
Reviews.Author: deniseallencan
Reviews.Content: I left a lengthy negative review on this site. The hotel manager did follow up with a phone call, which was very impressive, considering the level of service the hotel provided during my visit. He felt that since the "unexpected" rate change and addtional fees that were levied were "eventually" removed (after over an hour of negotiating) that my review was not accurate. The front desk Manager on Duty required I make the required calls to his central reservation office myself to complain about the rate doubling, the tripled pet fee, and the new parking fees that he insisted I pay. He eventually removed the fees but then had the nastiest attitude with me. I hope this clears up any confurion....

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: LynchburgScooter
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for the week but when we arrived the outside apperance was not good and when we asked to see the room we decided to forefit our deposit and find another motel. The refrigerator had roaches in it and the rest you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and pet friendly makes it even better!”
Reviews.Author: cheriamor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would recommend this beach front hotel to any one traveling with their pet..The manager went out of his way to make sure we were accommodated. We travel quite often with our westie and some of the other pet friendly hotels leave little to be desired...We were happy with the Bermuda house and the bed was comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: haha1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week and first day we had problems. First the sliding door didn't work. Second, we had mold on balcony and no one would clean it up! Mid- week one of us became very sick and felt like had flu- moved her to our second room where we didn't have mold and she was feeling better. Hotel has mold, problems w/ fixing things, and is bank owned b/c of bankruptcy. All of us have been in a way or another, sick. Nothing has been fixed and management are not very helpful and lie... Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: kneeboneVirgina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the bermuda house, we had a wonderful experience staying there, and enjoying the view of the ocean front hotel room from the 7th floor. Great room service and great customer service as well! Highly recommend this affordable yet beautiful resort to everyone. (Pool was also very nice)

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip highlighted by great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cameronan816
Reviews.Content: I headed into Ormond/Daytona area trying to find a reasonably priced hotel to spend the weekend with my girlfriend for her birthday. After a couple failed stops, we decided to check out the Bermuda House. We had two requirements- a balcony, and a pool, and Bermuda House met those requirements. As well as being reasonably priced, they offered a nice breakfast every morning, and were always helpful at the front desk. I did not make one request that was not fulfilled. The Bermuda House led us to have a great beach weekend and my girlfriend to have a great birthday weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: markpap68
Reviews.Content: I have been to Daytona before but never stayed at the north end. What a great choice. We were right across from a shopping center that has everything. Sports bar to groceries. The hotel was older but I got a great rate. The staff was excellent and the rooms were old but clean. The owners are tring to fix the place up. They have going in the right direction. What not to like. Great price great location.

Reviews.Title: “Dump, don't go”
Reviews.Author: smithwc
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. There were only about 3 cars there the whole time. Stay next door for 20 extra bucks a night at the LaPlaya Resort. Much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and excellent view”
Reviews.Author: sharibruce21
Reviews.Content: Friendly, great service,housekeeping was excellent,great view of beach

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: mmyounts
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the internet on all the websites we used did no justice to the hotel. It was not near that nice. One of the pictures we saw on one of the websites (I think Travelocity and bookit) had a picture of the pool for the hotel next door. You had rights to use the pool and restaraunt and stuff next door, but by no means should it have looked like it was part of this hotel. We stayed in two different rooms since we booked a few days then decided to add some. The first room was terrible. It smelled and we felt like we were sleeping in dirty beds adn the toilet didn't flush. The other room wasn't so bad. It still was outdated, but we were able to cope. The patio doors were very heavy. Heavy enough to where my husband had to always move it. I would not stay again, nor would I refer anyone to this place.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: mandapanda20
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews for this hotel before we left for our trip to Daytona. Most of them were not good but we were hoping for the best. We booked the hotel off of hotwire.com so we didn't even know where we were staying til it had already been charged so there was nothing we could do. I went with hopes of coming home and writing a good review about the place. I won't be doing that. But I won't be writing a bad one either. The price we paid for this hotel was $44 a night. It is oceanfront so that is cheap. We knew going in that this place wasn't going to be anywhere near a Hilton or upper class hotel like that. All and all, this place's biggest problem is that it needs to be remodeled. I think the hurricanes have been hard on it. It doesn't look much like the pictures anymore. We had several problems on our stay but most were fixed pretty quickly. I will say that our room was not exactly "toddler friendly". Our bathroom door was missing it's door knob. And, with an almost 2 year old who wants to get into everything, not being able to shut off the bathroom caused a lot of problems. No one wants their toddler playing in a toilet. We had a leak in our ceiling on our 2nd day caused by the AC unit in the room above us. In the hotel's defense though, it was fixed pretty quickly. Our microwave didn't work but they did replace it quickly after we complained. Our sliding glass door to our balcony was so hard to open that we very rarely used it. This couldn't be fixed but we were showed how to get it open. With the hotel being ocean front, things rust easily so we let it go. The "Tiki Bar" of this place was only open one night for a few hours during the 4 nights we were there. We were allowed to use to hotel next door's swimming pool as well which was nice. The hot tub at both places were out of order though. For the price we paid, and the hotel being ocean front, we got our money's worth though so I am not overly complaining. The hotel needs work. If you are worried about staying somewhere really nice and ocean front, don't stay here. But if you are more worried about just having a place to sleep and being ocean front, You would save money by staying here. Just be prepared to have a couple problems.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Rogue09
Reviews.Content: Good location, loved the ocean view, accessable to shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and Great view!”
Reviews.Author: BPNiota
Reviews.Content: What we paid for our room is what we expected out of the room. We got a great rate for about $40.00 a night. Stayed for 2 nights. Our room was on the bottom floor and had an Ocean view with a patio and chairs. The room had modern conviences such as a microwave, mini fridge and a sink. They also had some dishes. Other than the overall room needing some minor painting and the bathroom needed some attention it was overall a nice getway. The pool area was beautiful and the pool was also. However the spa wasn't filled at the time, but I'm sure it would have been nice. We had contienial breakfast which was very convenient. The staff was very helpful and polite. We had a wonderful time and loved every minute of it. We wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “What a Nightmare. It should not happen to anyone”
Reviews.Author: horneyFlorida
Reviews.Content: The lobby looked nothing like the picture on the internet. We knew right then we were in trouble. the parking lot was about empty and we still had pay $5 per day. Our room was on the 4th floor. When we left to get our luggage the room door would not lock. We told the front desk and she said someone will be right up. After almost a half hour and no one showed I asked the clerk for another room. She gave us another room. The a/c was very noisey but we kept the room. We went out to dinner and when we returned the key would not work in the door. The clerk, same one as when we checked in, even tried our key; no dice. She let us in with her master key, it was about 11:00pm. She said she would have it fixed asap. In the AM we took showers with the shower head leaking and spraying water everywhere. Before going to breakfast I tried the door and it was still broken. I was able to get the only maintenance man for two hotels. He finally got the door repaired. We would of loved to have used our balcony but we were not strong enough to open or close the door.Too bad it was a beautiful weekend. Yes we were only there for a weekend. Also we were told to park in the rear which had no lighting what so ever. Real customer service. When I was in the lobby I tried to use the water fountain and a restroom but neither was working. Overall the place was dirty, smelling of age, and in dire need of a complete make over . On the bright side the desk clerk was very pleasant; she had to be everyone had complaints, the pool was great and it is on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Kathie1965
Reviews.Content: Waiting to check in - a supervisor looks at me and says "you need something?" I said I was checking in. "name" that was the extent of the welcome to our hotel we received. Rooms need repair, couldn't close the bathroom door for privacy. They also charge $5 for parking but no ticket given to know who belonged parked at the hotel or not! Continental B-fast was frozen danish, cereal, and cold bagels. The manager brought his family in to eat for free though....

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Peglites
Reviews.Content: The air compressor fan was so loud, we had to turn off the air conditioner and use the fan so we could sleep. The carpet in the halls and elevator was dirty. The elevator smelled bad, couldn't hold my breath long enough to get to the 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Better all the Time”
Reviews.Author: sapha94
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Bermuda House. It was very affordable, compared to the neighboring hotels, and the staff was wonderful. The rooms were clean, and the ammenities were surprising and wonderful. It was not packed, so it was very quiet and it was so easy to get around, unlike other hotels where the elevator is in an inconvenient location. The pool is on the west side of the building, but hidden from traffic. I loved the pool. It was clean and the landscaping was beautiful. Because it is off the beach side, they are able to provide better seating and umbrellas and nothing is chained or bolted to the ground! The hot tub was not operating while we were there, but they were working on it. Pets are allowed here, but you wouldn't know it at all! There was no smell, no barking dogs, etc. Overall, I would recommend a stay here to anyone, as it was very affordable, comfortable, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Would of been better if the pool was heated”
Reviews.Author: nociti
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to Florida for 12 years iin April and this is the first time I stayed at a hotel where the pool was not heated. I don't understand that especially for a big vacation area like Daytona. I saw alot of rooms and some are better than others - look first. The LaPlaya is no better and they have double beds where Bermuda House has queens - and they were comfortable. Location is great - good shopping across the street plus restaurants. If you want good old fashion Italian food go to Lovece's Italian Restaurant in Ormond Beach. Turn right out of the hotel traveling north on Atlantic - a couple miles to Granada Blvd. Keep going north 2 1/2 miles on the left is the restaurant. Small plcae - great food. For a great breakfast try Alfies about 1 mile north from there. Front desk people will do everything they can to make your stay comfortable. Loved talking with LaToya - nice person. Just have fun - it's Florida and sunny and you can't get any closer to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mencoorslight
Reviews.Content: would not stay here again. first, prices on line & when you get there are different. They did honor the online price. Lobby looked fine until you go through the door to the elevator, that's where the nightmare begins. We were on the 4th floor. Elevator small, dirty, smelly. Hallway tile dirty with paper and dirt from outside, stayed there overnight and garbage was still there in the morning. hallway walls to room, dirty, needs painting. Room.. dirty & craked tiles greet you at the door. Room needs over haul. Shower tiles and floor tiles were disgusting. Balcony glass door needed two people to open it..maintance was called but never showed up. If you were overweight you could not go throught the door to the balcony. Glass door was filthy. Room Door does not close on its own, you have to put your key back in and pull handle up then close the door, if you didn't do this the door would not close. Didn't realize this until we returned to the room and couldn't figure out who left the door opened. Cleaning lady had to tell us the trick to closing the door. Hotel is on the beach, which is the only thing good about this hotel. Hotel needs major work!!

Reviews.Title: “worst place i've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: spookSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: Son was on college baseball trip - wanted to stay in the same place so booked a room, sight unseen. The place was gross, I slept in my clothes on top of the covers every night. Was afraid to use the bathtub! It smelled bad, the refrigerator didn't work for 3 days then they finally brought us another one. no internet access in the room, only the lobby and could never get connected there either. several players from other schools had laptops stolen, our team had two ipods stolen. Management was rude, they charge $5 a day to park your car!!! I would sleep in my car before I would ever stay there again. It was on the beach but that wasn't worth the crappy room.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: traceyjo2000
Reviews.Content: It was race week so we paid $150 per night for a $50 room but that was to be expected. I was worried that since it was one of the lowest priced hotels it would be a dump. The lobby was nice and the staff were great. Our room was a typical hotel room but we were surprised to see a kitchenette with stove, fridge, sink and dishes! A nice little addition. Our room faced the Atlantic ocean and we would sit and listen to the waves crash. It was a little further down the beach than we would have liked but oh well. They had a nice tiki bar by the pool and our bartender Joy was really great and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: WinterEscapeee
Reviews.Content: Location and service was what The Bermuda House had going for them. The lady checking us in was wonderful and after seeeing our room I called the front desk asking if they had any more rooms that may have been renovated, she was pleasant and understood why I was asking. Hotel has replaced the carpeting, beds and bedding and curtains but nothing more. Older hotel and the salt air has gotten the best of the rooms. Windows had lost the vapor lock so really hard to even look out the windows. Very difficult even opening the sliders to the balcony but worth the effort. Mold growing on the ceilings. We even had trouble flushing the toilet not just one day but throughout our stay. We had a wonderful oceanfront room on the 2nd floor with a balcony. We had a great walk on the beach and I enjoyed the pool (spa has been broken for years and still not fixed) and sitting on the balcony reading a book. After the second night, the room kinda grew on us and we enjoyed our stay but it really was very poor accommodations. Kitchenette was so bad we didn't even cook but within walking distance to a few restaurants. We would not stay there again until they upgrade. If you just want the ocean, it is okay but leave the light on!

Reviews.Title: “Wicked”
Reviews.Author: TzBootz
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, we had a fridge, micro-wave, sink. It was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The pool was nice and deep, we liked to party at the cabana by the pool. It was nice having the beach right there to go for a run! I will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back”
Reviews.Author: slipperyfl
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Had to get 3 different room cards to enter the room due to a problem with the card and maintaince problem. The kitchen floor was filthy, there was a hole in the wall behind the kitchen door. Their was sand all over the floor. The water in the shower did not drain out so had to stand in dirty water. The balcony ceilling had paint chipping off dropping on the floor of the balcony. Would never visit this hotel again and will inform all of our friends who regularly go to Daytona Beach for a week end get away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: jadesmommy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to take a spur of the moment trip to Daytona Beach for the Rolex 24 the weekend of the 23rd of January. I was a little doubtful about the type of place I was booking a room at, but for the price that i was paying, my expectations were not that high. Upon arriving there around 7 p.m., I checked in with ease. I could not believe how easy it was. Our room was on the 8th floor and the room was great. It had a kitchenette and an oceanview. I was highly impressed. After being there for 5 minutes, I knew that I would definitely bring our kids back for a summer vacation. Some aspects of the hotel are a little outdated but for less than $50 a night...who am I to complain? I loved this place and will definitely be coming back very soon. I HIGHLY recommend it to anyone looking for a nice place at a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the SERVICE !!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul067
Reviews.Content: Love the service. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. We have access to the Laplaya Hotel next door. Continental breakfast is available. Right in front of the Belair Shopping Plaza. The manager, Bradley Reising is very professional and friendly. I've been coming faithfully every year to get away from the cold in Canada for the last 8 years. I'll be back next year...

Reviews.Title: “All newly renovated room for a great price”
Reviews.Author: jsbsorlando
Reviews.Content: I am glad I did not read the other reviews before staying or I would have been scared away. I took my 5 year old to the beach and we stayed at the Bermuda House. I checked the room out first (827). Everything was new. New carpet, kitchen apliances, bathroom, beds, sheets and beding very clean. Great view of the Ocean from the balcony and intercoastal from the front. The toilet need to be flushed twice after use and the balcony was small but overall a great bargin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice eff., had separate kitchen”
Reviews.Author: kenben8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bermuda House for 9 days from Aug 29 thru Sept. 7th. Had an eff with separate kitchen 3rd level. We thought it was very nice for the price. Right next door to sister hotel La Playa which all amenities there can be used by anyone at Bermuda House. Was there at the time hurricane Hanna passed offshore and enjoyed the high surf very much. I would recommend anyone looking for a good bargain to check it out. Very friendly staff, Thanks Latoya, and also our very efficient housekeepers. We will keep it in mind for next trip to Daytona Beach. Ken/Bruce

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Commanderhottie18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here aug.24-2008 right after hurricane fay struck after reading all the bad reviews i was not going to give this place a second thought.I went the night before checking all the hotels down the strip the rooms were filthy and discusting and the prices exspensive for what you got,the bermuda house had new beds with new sheets great decor and the kitchenette was spotless the appliances were up to date and the ac was nice and cold I got a low rate of 59.00 which other hotels wanted 100.00 plus for filth!The hotel staff couldnt do enough for us they were working hard trying to clean and fix the water damaged caused when hurrican fay hit,oher hotels tried selling me a room still wet and damaged by fay. They have a very good breakfast and the room is spotless and new,the only thing i would have enjoyed better if the pool was on ocean side instead of courtyard but all and all see for yourself had a great time and great view and will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe all of the bad things you read and then some”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFun43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel August 8-10, 2008. Believe all the bad and then some. We went to bed late on Friday night and did not check the beds. On Saturday morning I found bed bugs and bloody sheets on our beds. The bathroom was filthy, we never took our shoes off. The smell was terrible throughout the hotel. There were bugs in the breakfast room. The pool deck was cracked and rough. We too got the excuse that they were shorthanded. I had to ask for the room charges to be taken off because of the bugs, and then they would only take off one night. There has been NO, NO, NO, NO remodeling done to this hotel. The staff was very nice, but I do not feel that they told the truth. As far as trip advisor, if this is number 69 I would hate to see what the other hotels on down the list were like. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone for any reason. It was disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “We had a GREAT TIME!!”
Reviews.Author: nyyffl
Reviews.Content: I feel bad for the people who had a bad experience at The Bermuda House, they really missed out! We stayed there for 3 days and it was just wonderful! Even the "partial" view of the ocean was wonderful, I was concerned that I wouldn't like our room because I wanted a full view of the ocean, but as you can see from the picture I snapped from our balcony it was just fine! The staff was wonderful and very polite and treated us like royalty. The pool was awesome, and the breakfast wasn't bad. The only problem I had was not wanting to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “its alright”
Reviews.Author: tripletboysmom
Reviews.Content: called the hotel before booking told them i would be traveling with a handicapped child and wanted to make sure the room would be clean upon arrivial the lobby was very small and hot got checked in and went to the room we were suppose to have a room with a partial view of the ocean we had an ocean front the room itself was okay clean the beds were clean and seemed pretty new The bathroom was pretty nasty though the floor didnt look clean It was said that this hotel was recently renovated!!! IT WAS NOT RENOVATED. But after speaking to other guest our room was immacualte and over all it was okay I wouldnt stay there agian but if you get the deal and its cheap like $40.00 a night it would do. By the end of the trip the toliet stop working.. The worst part was most of the reviews said the same thing but when i called the hotel its self they told me it was just redone and i felt i would take a chance as i know some can find something to complian about, but No this is not the cleanest hotel but if you bring bleach and hit the bath rom the room wasnt toooooo bad...

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: wacky99999
Reviews.Content: Immediately upon checking in and going to our room we had to check out. The room condition was terrible. The door to the room was difficult to open and to close. The lock on the door could not be secured. The room smelled of cigarette smoke and mold and we requested a non-smoking room. The room contained a connecting door to the next room which could also not be secured. The door was able to be opened. The bathroom was filthy and appeared to have not been cleaned from the previous visitor(s). There was hair in and round the shower and toilet. There was hair in and around the sink. There was sand on the bathroom floor and mold everywhere in the bathroom. Upon sitting on the bed, the bedspread was covered in sand. Pulling the sheets back to inspect the linens, the sheets were dirty and appeared to have not been changed from the previous customer. The sheets, well to put it nicely, were spotted from a night of love making. It was clear upon inspection these weren’t stains but actual soiled linens. Both the sheets and the blankets were dirty. We immediately checked out. We were informed by an employee that the Ocean Resorts company is trying to sell the hotels and are doing very little to maintain the properties. We went to a different hotel and paid double but at least wasn't in the filth the Bermuda House offered. I wouldn't even send a homeless person there. Don't waster your money.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanblue65
Reviews.Content: I don't know what year the "excellent" rating was written, but it certainly wasn't in 2008. I was very disappointed in the hotel. I could have had a much better hotel for the money just down the road... I had them show me FOUR rooms before I was "okay" with the fourth one... They said they had a shortage of maids. Several rooms were needing help... from warped doors that you had to shove in to open, to sliding balcony doors that didn't shut all the way or lock because they wouldn't shut. Cabinets looked like they were severely damaged. The front desk and their maintenance guy tried their best to find a room that was suitable for single women to stay in...so I can't say anything bad about them. But I was also told the company who owns that hotel, owns 20 some odd hotels. It's obvious they need to get rid of a few hotels and take care of the ones that need repairs. Had an incident while we were there... a piece of concrete from a balcony broke off and landed on a car below, damaging the car. Police were on the scene and filed a report. Breakfast was basically cereal and muffins... so we went to Denny's nearby for breakfast. I didn't see any bugs...so that was one thing I could say that was positive about this place. If you are just looking for a place to lay your head, then this will work... but I won't be returning for any length of stay... and won't recommend this place to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler90
Reviews.Content: I will never go back to this property or any other Ocean Waters Property. The room was very dirty and so was the rest of the property. The balcony was cracked with th rebar sticking out of the concrete. The hot tub was out of service and looked like it had been for a very long time. We have stayed at many hotels in daytona and ormond and have found that hotels that were once nice and clean have gone down hill after being purchased by these people. I understand investments but we shouldnt be left to pay premier resort prices for run down dumps.

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: deedeekayFlorida
Reviews.Content: The room was OK, felt it was too expensive for what you got. Front door was the pitts, flopped in the breeze, locked by the security lever only, the floor tile was very dirty in the bathroom & kitchette area, housekeeping must not do mopping. Frig was cold, A/C worked good, beds were comfortable & had clean sheets, bathroom had clean towels, needs some wall tile & grout attention (replaced), supplied 2 room keys, only one worked, the hot tub / spa broken, pool was nice and clean. Exterior needs some structure help, entire building & balconys spardling from years of salt water breeze. This place was OK for a beach bum getaway, it was 50/50.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: jstrickland08
Reviews.Content: Me and My boyfriend attended the Coke Zero 400 in Daytona. We both got a couple of extra days off so we decided to make it a mini vacation. I called a number of places (last min) and was shocked at the jacked up prices. And most of the hotels would not rent out to single couples under 25. We are both 23. I finally had luck with the Bermuda House. Jennifer answered the phone and was very friendly. When we arrived for our vacation our hotel was easy to find. It was nice on the outside. Not a huge hotel but not a small hole in the wall either. I went inside to check in and was greeted by the friendly staff. We got our keys and off to our room we went. Our room was hot at first but soon got cool after we adjusted the temp. It was very clean and neat. Not what you would find at the Hilton but I am not the type to stay at a fancy place like that, but it was a very nice hotel. The beds were comfy, the bathroom was nice. The only problem I had was our door. It was really hard to shut. Overall our stay at the Bermuda House was excellent! I would stay again~!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice oceanfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnk555
Reviews.Content: All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Bermuda House. We were a little concerned when we checked in to see that the elevator and hallways were a little dirty and beat up. But our room was nice, roomy and moderately clean (considering it's by the ocean). The breakfast was excellent, and the staff was very nice. The location is awesome. They are right on the beach! Their pool was excellent, with nice landscaping too! Unfortunately, the hot tub was down. Considering the modest room rates, this is a very acceptable hotel. It isn't the newest but it does put you in the thick of the beach area at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Bermuda House - not so good the second time.”
Reviews.Author: crabbyGreensboro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one year ago and enjoyed our stay. No problems. That is why we decided to stay here again this year. We were in Daytona for a funeral and only stayed one night. This time the experience was completely different. The next morning there was no hot water at all. The refridgerator did not cool well at all. One elevator was under repair. Fortunately we were on the third floor. The air conditioning unit did not cool the room very well at all.

Reviews.Title: “The Place for Working Families”
Reviews.Author: formerfarrington
Reviews.Content: Considering the price paid for this experience I would rate it excellent.This is a place where working people can go and enjoy the ocean. We were greeted by a friendly and cooperative staff. The building is not new and the interior does show normal wear and tear , the bathroom fixtures were functional . Our linens were clean and replaced as needed. If you are looking for the brand spanking new you'd better go somewhere else and pay 4 times as much. Otherwise, the rooms( we booked three) were spacious and had a small fridge, an electric stove, a microwave, coffee pot, iron, an electric hairdryer, and a good size television(cable of course). We only used the fridge for leftovers as we ate out for lunch and dinner. There was a five dollar a day parking fee and a $1.50 safe fee that will be waived when you check out if you have not used it. The free continental breakfast was comparable to that served by the Hampton Inn chain. Had we stayed there it would have cost us 4 times as much as it did here. The hot tub was not working at the time so we were encouraged to use the hot tub at their neighboring hotel, La Playa. We only wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite spot, usually......”
Reviews.Author: wuzup
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here 2 months ago, but this time I was a little disappointed. My problems were as follows: I like to stay on the highest floor in a ocean front room. Elevators (2) were broken. Still wanted upper floor so had to use stairs:( Also, when maid cleaned our room, she took dirty towels, but didn't leave us any clean ones! The jacuzzi was broken, that was a disappointment! Other than that it was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Bowling can be fun at the right place to stay”
Reviews.Author: anirt21
Reviews.Content: When checking in , I thought that it was strange that if I pay for a room , why should I have to pay to park within the area. Other than that, the stay was overall good. My room door had a few problems, such as grimy finger prints. I did not use the safe although I did feel uncomfortable being on a ground floor since those are the ones most broken into. Your higher management staff, Shane, Bradley and Paul were very responsive. I would probably give this hotel another try, but it probably won't be until next year, if you are lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Our bowling trip....:)”
Reviews.Author: hopeycrestview
Reviews.Content: We got here on a Friday afternoon. The check in staff was great. Very friendly and had information about the hotel. His name was Tron and he made sure that I knew were my room was and where to park and were my room was. He also told me about the continental breakfast and that the elevator was broken by my room, but I had another choice to go to another elevator or take the stairs. The breakfast room was very clean and neat. There was a nice selection to choose from. After we got back from bowling we went to the Tiki Bar for some RR and Montana was the BEST bartender in town. She was very knowledgable in what she was making and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “weekend at Bermuda House”
Reviews.Author: Occasionaltraveler16
Reviews.Content: We spent Memorial Day weekend at Bermuda House in Daytona Beach. It was a great location (on the beach!) and comfortable hotel. The pool was big, with a tiki bar on the patio. Nice deck area with plenty of loungers, and a few umbrella covered tables. Towels were available, too. Easy beach access around the back of the hotel. It was a comfortable room to return to after some fun in the sun. We choose a room with a kitchen area due to dietary restrictions of some of the travelers. (They do offer continental breakfast in a Breakfast Room near the pool.) The kitchen area was a separate room which made for some nice meal times - and a place for adults to chat while the kids watched TV in the next room. It was small, but served it's purpose - a place to eat before heading out again. We all agreed we would stay there again. Staff was very helpful and polite, especially considering the busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Bad surprise”
Reviews.Author: CCJL
Reviews.Content: We got there after booking on internet for a three stars hotel. We got there and were told that our reservation was only for the next day. Lucky that I had the confirmation on hand. Had to call Bookit.com to do something as the hotel representative did not want to do anything. That was the first surprise. The second that was we had confirmed an oceanfront view room and got a pool room. This was immediately corrected after asking. Third and the worst, it was indicated that they had renovated room. Well the renovated rooms were apparently on the eight floor but with no elevator so impossible to rent. So we got a room not renovated with a front ocean view but we could not open the patio door as it was so damaged that you could not believe it. The jacuzzi was not working apparently since the same day and the pool not heated as it said on their website and so dirty as they did not wash the sides for months. Did I mention the noise of the air conditioning unit that was louder than an airplane motor! Certainly not a three stars!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: cstarling29
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel before reading reviews about it. Ther are so many bad reviews about the hotel that I was very concerned and worried to take my family. I have to tell you, I was very surprised. First off the girl working at the front desk was great. I made the mistake of not reading when it says that check-in was at 3pm.(We showed up at 12:45) by 1:30 she had us in our room so we didn't have to wait outside with the kids in the heat. The elevator by our room was out of order so we did have to walk a little more but who doesn't need the exercise? The pool was great but the Hot Tub was not working which was my only disappointment. But--You are welcome to walk next door to LaPlaya, which is owned by the same people, to use anything there. This includes the hot tub, indoor and outdoor pool, contenintal breakfast ,ect. For what we paid for the room, I couldn't believe it. We really enjoyed it and will definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: bostwicktim
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at Bermuda House we were greeted by a happy clerk, I felt like he worked directly, and only for me. Though only there two nights my wife and were treated with dignity,respect,and concern. Being man-made, the airconditioning went out during our stay,as soon as we told the A.M. clerk she sent for it to be repaired.It was not uncommon to see security around the property,which really comforted my wife. I never said this about a motel,but I will return to Bermuda Houseon my next stay in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “great low price hotel”
Reviews.Author: razzlepuff
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our anniversary trip in Daytona. This trip we stayed at Bermuda House in Daytona Beach, Florida. With gas prices as high as they are, we attempted to stay at a hotel with cheaper rates. We also have a puppy and pet friendly hotels were of interest to us. The rates at the hotel were wonderful. so wonderful, in comparison to area hotels, that I was really worried prior to arrival about the quality of the hotel. But...it was great! I guess it had been recently remodeled because the decor was beautiful and it was very clean. We had an large ocean front room with a large kitchen. The pool area was beautiful. The pool was huge with new chairs and tables. They had a tiki hut with drinks too if desired. It was a very affordable place with wonderful accomodations. We will be returning to this hotel...if we can afford the gas!

Reviews.Title: “Lap top, Ipod, camera, phone, cash stolen”
Reviews.Author: 1Baseballmom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and on the second day came back to room and all our stuff was stolen. No forced entry, hmmmm. The sliding door doesn't lock, the safe doesn't work. We stayed on the 4th floor. Called the police, the hotel said they will "investigate". Unfortunatly it was spring break so we couldn't move to another hotel. We will never stay here again. Beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “why i didnt read reviews for this hotel....i have no clue”
Reviews.Author: SROTAGOG
Reviews.Content: we just got back from this place. we were there for about five days four nights and and why i just started to read reviews for this hotel, I DONT KNOW.... because if i would have like a normal traveler would do, i dont think i would have stayed there. and having stayed there i dont think i will ever stay there again or recomend anyone stay there ever....UNLESS you like hotels that are like [--] holes, faulty EVERYTING. and just an all around TRIP, KILL-JOY. now i will say the view of the beach from a ocean front balcony room is breath taking but that is still not enough to blind you from the reality that this place really needs to step their game up. i would not recomend anyone with children like myself to stay there, for mold/mildew is not the best thing for you to breath. if you were to ask me i think that the owner needs to fix all thats wrong, insted of telling thier employees, to tell the customers- "oh, well you can just go over to the La Playa" -for all the faulty/non-existint acomidations that they clearly advertise ...

Reviews.Title: “my first family vacation and the first day had to find a new hotel after a 16hou”
Reviews.Author: jessicawilliams
Reviews.Content: my mother in law booked the rooms 2 weeks before are stay we got there and the rooms stunk! they were so bad we had to go to a differnt hotel and the people told us that they were just remodeled rooms before we drove 16 hours to stay we had 3 mini van with 9 kids 9 adults it was very frustrating to half to find a new gotel we looked for 2 hours and ended up paying like 500.00 more for the trip than expected it was horrible they need to up date their pics cause the ones you see are not the way it looks

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE! My Son caught a NASTY RASH!!!”
Reviews.Author: tkmom05
Reviews.Content: I went to the website! It's nothing like the website online!!! Pictures are way better than the real deal. I took my four kids, ages 8-10-12-and 16 for just a relaxing weekend even though it was Feb.. The best thing about the whole deal was the bagels and cheese danishes in the free breakfast. The pool was ok, but after only swimming in it for about 30 minutes, about an hour later my youngest son has this nasty rash under his arm????? I think it may be a bacterial infection he either caught in the room or by the pool. The room was terrible, moist and uncomfortable. The air was broken. Cigarrette burns on the comforter. Stains every where--here and there! Even stains on the ceiling. You had to wiggle the bathroom door to get it to close properly. I don't like to complain....I am way too nice.....They know what kind of rooms they are renting.....it stunk! When you pack up four kids and finally move into a room. It's hard to move out to change. After a long day teaching, and a two hour drive there....my heart didn't want to focus on the bad.....but make the most of it! We went shopping instead of hanging out. We'll never go back there,.......my advice....find somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Bermuda House Was Great”
Reviews.Author: mully64
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week at the Bermuda House in Daytona Beach, Dec 31 - Jan 7. Our sideview room had been upgraded to an ocean front unit and we found the recently updated room to be large, clean and comfortable with a great view of the beach and ocean. The kitchenette had a new full sized fridge, a stove, microwave, the 2 large beds were clean and comfy as was the bathroom. The pool area was very nice with a heated pool, spa ( which was out of service ) and Tiki bar and was bathed in sunshine from about 8:30 am to about 5:30 pm.as the pool is on the streetside of the hotel. Most other hotels pools are beachside and out of the sun by noon. We were able to use the pools and spas at the LaPlaya resort next door so the spa being out of service was no big deal. The staff were all friendly and helpful from the front desk to housekeeping and maintenance. The hotel is located right across from The Bellair Plaza with a Publix, dollar store, shoe stores, clothing stores liquor store etc., very handy. great places to eat are within walking distance. We enjoyed our stay at Bermuda House and would highly recommend it to everyone for a great place to stay. I know we are planning to return next March break

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the "pits"”
Reviews.Author: beadqueen
Reviews.Content: My cousin booked a set of rooms for our group for a family reunion. She had stayed at the hotel before and said it was good. She is from Florida and I guess they are used to a different level of hotels than I am. Our rooms were on the first floor by the pool, which was convenient for hanging out. My room smelled like mildew and was in need of a good cleaning, carpets, bathroom and floors. The lamp on one side of my bed didn't work, so I told housekeeping and they said it wasn't plugged in because there weren't any plugs on that side of the room. It was just there to balance the look of the lamp on the other side of the bed. Out of five rooms for our group, none of the safes worked. They automaticly charge you $1.50 per day, even if your safe doesn't work. You then have to ask to have it deducted at the end of your stay. They also charge $5.00 per day to park. Because we had some problems with our rooms, they deducted that charge too. One of our rooms had broken cabinet doors in the kitchenette. All of our rooms had trouble with hot water. I let my shower run for a long time and never did get really hot water. Both the showers I took were lukewarm at best. I agree with other reviewers that the staff was very friendly and nice and the pool was very nice. Unfortunately that doesn't make up for the fact that the owners of the property haven't maintained it. The rooms are dirty, out of date and in disrepair. I would recommend staying elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: EastTennesseeSgt
Reviews.Content: stayed oct.4th-oct.7th, 2007, room on 4th floor, room and bathroom smelled bad, first day there circuit blew in the bathroom while we were taking a shower, had to get staff to repair. Elevator is in poor shape, looks like will quit at any moment. Hotel needs to be updated very badly. The only nice thing about it was the staff was nice and the pool was nice. I would never recommend anyone to stay there. It is not very often that we get to vacation and to have a hotel in this poor condition is very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, Musty, Poor physical plant, Great service”
Reviews.Author: CarScott
Reviews.Content: While not a flea bag hotel, it is no better than 1.5 stars. We had two rooms at this hotel. One was second floor and liveable, meaning it was dry and odorless and in relatively good condition. The furniture and fixtures are old and dated, the bathroom was small with a non-functioning exhaust fan (meaning it was a damp room that effected the room as a whole). Bathroom fixtures were old, somewhat stained, but all worked as expected. The cleanliness of the carpet was a concern the whole time. The door to the balcony was old, difficult to open, and had almost-rotted hardware. The view of the beach was very nice. The other room, #115, was damp throughout with a terrible musty odor. Even pulling the bedsheets back revealed the underlying covers to be damp The shower head made one small steady stream. This room should be sealed off permanently. In both rooms the TV and air conditioning were like-new and worked very well. The pool area is incredible - nice furniture, great pool area, and well maintained pool. The breakfast area was similarly nice. Every one of the outside doors (except the main front door) was in poor repair. Missing or barely-there hardware, very inclean to the touch, and quite old. Continental breakfast was cereal, prepackaged danish, instant oatmeal and grits, juice and coffee. Staff was always pleasant and accomodating. The hotel is a study in contrasts. Very nice public areas with courteous and helpful staff. Quite poor rooms that seem to have suffered the ravages of age without adequate investment in physical plant maintenance. We paid $70/night for a beach front room; comparatively a good price for a view of the beach. However, for another $40/night I stayed at the LaQuinta down the street. It too is beach front but my room was not. However, the rooms here were clean, well maintained, and comfortable. I'd spring for the extra $40/night in a heartbeat. No amount of excellent courteous service can overcome a poorly maintained room. You have better options in Daytona along the same beach in a similar price range. Do yourself a favor and exercise those opions.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible -”
Reviews.Author: family10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old & run down. The rooms are damp & smelly & the carpet looks like you don't want to walk on it in bare feet. They spray strong air freshners in the hallways to cover it up. We booked 2 rooms- one had stains on the ceiling & walls from leaks. The kitchenetts are not like the ones you see on the website. They are very old & the oven partially worked. We had to ask for the cooking pots which were supposed to be in the cupboards, the chairs that were supposed to be at the table, and the cover for the air conditioning unit. The staff was very prompt to take the items from another room and bring them to us. One of our rooms was missing the iron, ironing board, hair dryer, & coffee pots. The toilet had trouble flushing & the shower backed up. The elevators were scary looking & smelly, and the posted inspection sign was outdated. There was a very strong sulfer odor in the courtyard where the pool was that burned my nostrils. We ended up leaving early, as I was severely dissappointed. This hotel was nothing like it appeared to be on the website. Stick with the hotel brands that you know.

Reviews.Title: “Was...o.k.”
Reviews.Author: Maizefamily07
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Bermuda House on August 13th. After a long day of flying we wanted to just get to our room and relax. The man at the counter gave us our keys and a map of the hotel and started to highlight everything that the hotel offered and then highlighted our room and said it was on the forth floor. We got into the elevator, which was VERY scary, old, smelly, and the date to have it inspected was expired. So we rode up to the room and the door was slightly open. Not wanting to disturb anyone if it was occupied, I asked the maid if this was the room the man in the lobby told us was ours. She looked at our keys and told us that our room was on the first floor. So we rode the elevator back down to the first floor and went to the room she told us to go to...uh...it didn't even have a lock...or a door knob for that matter. So I went back to the lobby and asked the man what our room number was. He looked at me like I was stupid and said it was on the forth floor and gave me the room number. So we went back up and into the room we were at first that was slightly open. I guess the door doesn't shut all the way and you litterally have to put some body weight into it when you want it shut. The room wasn't bad, I will say. No stains on the bed or bugs anywhere that I could see. The bathroom was bad however. It was dirty and moldy and if you wanted to flush the toilet you had to hold in the handle. Our last day there we left almost all day and came back to find our room open because the housekeeper didn't shut the door all the way. Thankfully, all our stuff was still inside. The pool was nice, clean and warm. Although, one reason we wanted to stay here was for the Tiki Bar, which was only open twice the entire week and late at night, and the jucuzzi, which was not open the entire time. The bartender at the tiki bar was VERY nice. We told her about our room and she told us that she hears that ALOT and she hears alot worse. Breakfast is just different types of cereal and sometimes bagels. It has eazy beach access and that was definatly the best part of the trip. Although nothing went terribly wrong at this hotel, I probably would never stay at it again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Bermuda House”
Reviews.Author: mommy3kg
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a week-long vacation in Daytona Beach and even though it started off rocky after we found our rooms at The Bermuda House things were okay! I had booked a SUITE at the Desert Inn Resort and after getting there and actually seeing the DUMP I got my money back and had to find somewhere else to stay! So we found The Bermuda House and the manager was AWESOME! We got a GREAT nightly rate! I am going to start off with my complaints of the place, which by the way are not many...when we checked in the manager told us we would have "connecting" rooms and I as well as everyone else I was with expected them to be so that we could walk freely in between 2 rooms...that was not the case...I guess connecting to him meant side by side! Also, my mother in law's air conditioning was leaking and soaked the floor, they moved them rooms and the other one was fine! The elevator sounds like it could break down any second and was really really dirty! As far as our rooms went they were very clean and comfortable, my only complaint about them were the bathrooms could have been a little cleaner...the shower curtain was a little dirty and the toilet was broken on the back...but overall they were very clean and comfortable! Now I will say that the pool was AWESOME...very very clean and my husband and father in law really enjoyed the Tiki Bar when it was open...but it wasn't open as much as we would have liked...I had my two small children with me ages 3 1/2 and 2 and they LOVED it...my 3 1/2 year old absolutely loved the pool there and had a blast!! So let me just say Thank you Bermuda House for making my children's first vacation to the beach a memorable one! Overall my family was completely satisfied and we would stay again if we come back to Daytona Beach...but beware that Daytona Beach is overall not as nice as other places in Florida! Bermuda House thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “Bermuda House is a family favorite and will be our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: bbeg
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Bermuda House this summer and we have already made plans to stay again in two weeks. We loved the atmosphere, the helpful staff, and the whole experience as a whole.I highly recommend this hotel. The price is phenominal and the beach access and crowd is awesome. I could plainly watch my boys have a blast and make great family vacation memories that I hope will last a lifetime. And I have the management and staff to thanks for this. We will return everytime we plan on a beach trip. Thank you Bermuda House. Our family thinks YOU ROCK!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarshallBeach
Reviews.Content: Location was great...room was very clean...which means alot to me...no noise from other guest...pool was great...this was our 2nd stay (1st time was under a different name)...enjoyed Bermuda House very much...will stay same place next time Ronnie and Penny Wilde

Reviews.Title: “My stay at The Bermuda House”
Reviews.Author: supervixen87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from The Bermuda House in Daytona Beach Florida. I have read the other reviews from the hotel and well I dont really agree with any of them. I do not want to come out and sound completely biased either way I just want to tell in all honesty, my experience. I booked reservations for an ocean front efficiency double beds upper floor room 3 nights, total of 422.06 this was confirmed by 2 different women that work for ocean waters resort. Grand total of 422.06 remember that. Well when my boyfriend and I got there my first impression was a girl named Jamey greeting us with a look on her face like she was completely drugged up. Her eyes were rolling and she was holding her head, when we first walked up to the front she was standing up from hanging her head by her knees...Im not quite sure what was going on but she complained of a headache with "surging pain." She listed some symptoms, I am a pharmacy technician and recognized these symptoms as some kind of problem brought on by chemical abuse but that is beside the point. She pulled up the reservations which were under my name but only addressed them to my boyfriend. She did not check my ID so anyone could have stayed there and charged it to my card, she got my boyfriend to sign some paper and did not ask me a single question even though the reservations were made under my name, which is obviously a female name. She tried to give me a room with a king sized bed. This was the coversation "Is it just the two of you?" Well reservations should have told her that. "Yes" looking at my boyfriend the whole time now. "So you don't mind if you have a kingsized bed?" me--" Well didn't I make reservations for two queen sized beds?" "well yeah, but since you two are a couple I didnt think you would mind. " "Well, personally I would like to get what I made reservations for." "Ok, well we have a room on the 4th floor." "I thought I made reservations for upper level Is that not available?" "Oh yeah but its not ready yet." "Well we can wait until it is." She let us see the room anyways it was terrible. It was in an older section and was quite randown. We waited for room 823. When I went to pay I asked for the total, she was just going to charge it to my card and not even tell me the price. When I asked she said 557 dollars and some change. My eyes grew wide and I politely said that I got the price of 422.06 confirmed by two different women, one just a few days earlier. She said it was 557 and another girl, who seemed to be sober told me she could knock 10 dollars a day off but I did not want to do that because my reservations confirmed at 422.06. We had mentioned wanting to charge the first night on my card and pay the rest in cash, they used this to attempt to confuse us with by saying "well it is 422.06 after you charge the deposit." I told them it was the overall total that was at 422.06.I was getting no where so we said wed look at the room and used the opportunity to discuss the situation at hand,and my, now furious, boyfriend told me "Stay in the room Im going to fix this" He went down stairs and spoke with the manager who, proceeded to have him haggle for the price I was told I would have to pay. First she said 20 a day off, then 60 off for the deposit this is when he knew that she could give it to us for the price we were quoted, then she told him some stuff about him handling this professionally blah blah blah, this is when he came up to the room and told me the conversation. The manager called and said she would give us the room for the price we were quoted. Here's what I think happened, While my boyfriend was talking to the manager down stairs he said customers were coming in and they were telling them they were sold out, I dont believe it because in our stay they had a lot of vacant rooms. there was only one other couple in the floor we were on. I think that when we showed up they recognized us as being young, Im 20 and petite and my boyfriend is almost 25. I think that when I was discussing the price she thought she could pull it over on me because I am a girl, I will tell you right now I was going to leave that hotel before my boyfriend was and not to mention I am 1/2 irish so I know how to pitch a fit. I think the whole price jump was due to us being young and them thinking we were nieve, well Ive been to Daytona plenty of times I know the going rates of a lot of the hotels and 557 for THAT place was entirely too high, not to mentin I know what I was quoted. I also feel that they wanted us to think it was full so we would stay thinking we couldnt find another room. So if you still want to book a room here I would highly recommend booking over the phone and having them email,fax, mail the reservations I had to confirm over the phone because they couldnt email me for some reason. When we were actually in the room I noticed there was no shower curtain, only three pots, 2 mugs, 2 plats, 2 small bowls, 2 forks, 1 butter knife, 2 spoons and a weird looking knife. No frying pan or spatula, one pitiful aluminum cookie sheet. The stove, oven, fridge, microwave all worked great The view was nice, I enjoyed the balcony, the room did not look bad at all, there was a problem with termites in the bathroom though. Only two drawers, 2 vanities, one outside the bathroom one inside. Some mold on the tiles in the bathroom and the tub looked awful. There were smudges and grease all over the windows the floors needed mopping, I pretty much cleaned the entire first day. The maid only made the beds once during our stay and on that day she knocked once said "housekeeping" and in about 15 seconds swung the door open then apologized for barging in...She later returned with a shower curtain, more coffee, towels and made the beds. The second day she knocked a couple of times and I greeted her she asked if I needed anything, I said more coffee, she handed me some and new towels and ask that I hand her the dirty ones, well my boyfriend was in the shower so I couldnt so she told me to bring them to her and that was the last we saw of her for the remainder of the trip. Which was just as well because I cleaned everything the whole time anyways. The pool area is beautiful and the staff did a good job of keeping the place clean, it was the maid that did a bad job of keeping our room clean. So I left cleaning stuff and a frying pan in the room, maybe the people that are in it now will get use out of it. It appeared that the females that worked there were not effecient so if you book here, talk with a man, certainly not Jamey lol. Oh yeah and bewarey of the elevator it looks like its ready to break down any minute. If it was not for the haggling thing I would not completely turn my nose at booking here, I did not hate the room. It was not the best but I would consider booking it if I could not get reservations at nicer places. For the price there are better hotels to stay at especially if it really is 557 for 3 nights!! I would NEVER pay that much to stay there for 3 days. I have pictures if anyone is interested in seeing them. I just got home from the trip, actually and have not had the time to upload them so just let me know if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay @ The Bermuda House!”
Reviews.Author: kelsayssmile
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Bermuda House was very pleasant. The rooms were clean, the staff was very friendly, great location, a beautiful view and probably the only hotel I have ever stayed at where I saw the manager walking around checking on and talking to staff. I also noticed that it was a great family friendly atmosphere! I enjoyed my stay there and my family did too, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Bermuda House Rocked!”
Reviews.Author: trueariesbeauty
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Bermuda House and my stay was very enjoyable. The rooms were very spacious and the view was amazing! I loved the tiki bar at the pool and the staff was extremely nice and helpful. The manager even introduced himself to us and I was very impressed by that! I will definently be staying at the Bermuda House the next time I visit Daytona Beach and I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: awhitt99
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from a week's stay at the Bermuda House. I was a little worried about the place after seeing some bad reviews. I'm not sure what some people expect, but we were both very pleased with the service, friendliness of staff, cleanliness, value, and location. There were only minor problems during the entire stay. There seemed to be a shortage of towels at one point during the weekend, which were brought up to us later that day after they were washed. At one point, we encountered no running water in our room, which was completely repaired within 10 minutes of having called front desk. The hotel is not brand new, and it is right on the beach. Some things were a little bit run down, such as there being a crack in the rear hotel access door, the floor lights of the elevator did not work, and the carpet in the elevator wasnt the freshest......which bothered some guests, but having lived in Florida before, I understand that things get wear and tear very easily, especially being right on the beach and going through hurricanes and storms almost every year. I must say that I did not check out the continental breakfast, as there are way too many great eateries in the Daytona area that I wanted to go to. The pool was sparkling clean and beautiful, and located perfectly. The pool is actually not oceanfront, but behind the largest of the hotel's two buildings, which is actually beneficial, because in the mid-afternoon when the sun starts going behind the buildings of other near-by hotels' pools, the pool at the bermuda house still had plenty of sun to enjoy into the evening. Staff was very friendly and helpful at the front desk, maintenance, and housekeeping. The view was spectacular, and the beach access was very convenient. Overall, if you can look past the minor wear-and-tear that ocean-front hotels get during the season, it was a very nice place to stay at a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on the beach”
Reviews.Author: gardenladyApharetta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a beachfront room the first week of April. We found the staff to be very friendly and the room to be clean and comfortable. There were a few minor problems, but they were handled right away. the beach access was quite convenient to our room. Continental breakfast could use a little updating but was sufficient. A special thanks to Marie, Eddie and Ricky for their assistance with all we needed to make our stay comfortable. I recommennd this hotel for affordability and beach front access as well as cleanliness. trip advisor member,ddc/Alpharetta, GA.4/15/07

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience. !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: catoasch
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK, clean and everything, but the problem is that when they tell you that is beach front they don't tell you that there is a parking lot between the room and the beach, so instead of listening to the ocean you hear all the cars. Then nobody cleaned our room during the time we were there. They were understaffed, you can't charge anything to the room it has to be cash. They don't have enough towels at the pool or the room for that matter. After I left I realized I left my VERY expensive pair of jeans over there. When I called they said that they couldn't get a hold of anyone in housekeeping. I called 3 times and left messages, today finally when I called back they said that nobody came across my jeans. But they never called me back. Don't go to this hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomGeorgia
Reviews.Content: I was right to trust the newest reviews for this hotel. The room was clean. Matresses new, carpet new. Very quiet at night. Microwave and fridge very clean. Breakfast was good in quality and selections. Problems do still exist: strike plate for bathroom door prevented the door from properly closing, the ac/heat unit had an odd odor (not necessarily a bad odor, just odd), sheets were a little scratchy, beds were not properly made daily, carpet was not vacummed daily, patio door could not be closed by one person, housekeeping staff unfriendly, clean towels not left in room. Front desk staff was very responsive to questions, concerns, and needs. Having the charge for the room safe removed from bill was not a problem. Hotel DOES charge $5 per day for parking. Not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Bermuda House is a disgrace.”
Reviews.Author: blazed42
Reviews.Content: The Bermuda House is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. When we arrived on Wednesday, to our "newly renovated" room it was dirty, and smelled strange. We requested a room change, and they moved us to a better room. However, there was no phone. Just a phone cord. We called down to the front-desk to get a replacement and they said "Well, do you really need a phone?" I said yes, and they brought one up 4 hours later as I was about to go to bed. I tried to use it the next day and it didn't work. There was no remote control for the TV. Nobody cleaned our room once over the 2 days we stayed there. We had planned on staying for 4 days, but cut our entire trip short because of this awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: croson-101
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, newly renovated, but suprised at some aspects that had not yet been fixed or weren't fixed. (ie elevator and flooring, etc.). Overall cleaniness was nice, nice hotel, great views of both the ocean and pool deck, complimentary breakfast, direct access to beachfront. Overall experience was satisfactory :)

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grannyfaye74
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Bermuda House in Daytona Florida. I had heard that they were having rennovations done and was a little worried about staying there. To my surprise the stay was wonderful. The staff was very pleasant and although there was rennovations going on it was beautiful. I would recommend the Bermuda House for anyone traveling to Daytona, Florida and I would definitely return there in the future for my vacationing needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: BenniesBabe
Reviews.Content: The people that worked at the Bermuda House were very nice. There was a lot of construction going on so things were kind of messy. The hot tub had construction going on so we couldn't use it. The bathroom in our room was kinda dirty, but everything else was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like COCKROACHES!”
Reviews.Author: zimmazimm
Reviews.Content: This place was an absolute DUMP! Do not EVER take your family to this place! You will regret it. There were cockroaches in the kitchen area, in the drawers, in and behind the fridge, in the stairwells (those were so big they could've even my daughter in one bite). When I talked to the front desk, they really didn't care....like it was a normal occurance almost. He said he didn't have anymore rooms, but when I persisted, he finally put me in another room. When we got there, it wreaked of smoke and whatever else. My wife has asthma, so we could not stay there. He gave me yet another room. It was nasty and outdated, but there were (seemingly) no cockroaches. There was a weird looking rug in the middle of the floor which seemed out of place. When we lifted it up, there was the biggest blood stain I had ever seen. It was disgusting. We had fun talking pictures laying next to it and acting like we were dead, but it was still nasty. Their elevators were like something out of a horror movie. They looked so questionable, I was afraid we wouldn't make it. The whole place was simply awful. Enter at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: steven98h
Reviews.Content: We read the previous reviews on this hotel and we were going to give it a chance. I did not make my family stay at this hotel. It was very filthy the elevator felt like it was on its last leg. Once I opened the door to my room I saw there were huge crumbs on the floor, then I noticed that the door to the adjoining room wouldn't lock completely and you could see some lights yo the other room as if somebody would be able to get the door open from their side. Also the doors that led out to the balcony wouldn't lock and I felt that was the last straw. I ended up staying at the Holiday Inn down the road out of pocket for one night. The only nice thing I could say about this place is that the girls at the front desk were nice. This is just speculation, the front desk clerk at the Holiday Inn said that a man bought the Bermuda House after the hurricanes of the previous year and doesn't have the money to fix it up. Please don't stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! My e-mail address is steven98h@yahoo.com if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid, very afraid!”
Reviews.Author: dasbook
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel. It needs a major renovation and until that happens it will be a slum. Dirty, smelly and totally unacceptable at whatever price. My companion and I paid $79 and booked on the hotel website for one night. It looks great on the computer!! All the negative things in the other reviews are true and not exaggerated. Other guests were complaining to us in the elevator as we went to our room for the first time and we knew right then it was a mistake. This was our first trip to Daytona and it will go down in history as the night we spent in a horrible, stinking, lousy hotel. We checked out at 8AM because we couldn't wait to leave. Go anywhere else but don't go here!

Reviews.Title: “do not waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: tellergal81
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to check in on 7/5/06 when we arrived at 4:30 we were told our room was not ready it was supposed to be being cleaned so we had to wait about an hour. We were finally given keys to the room. We unloaded the car took every thing in only to find a nasty nasty room. There was some sort of straw on the bed that my 5 year old picked up first thing I can only hope it was for coffee and not drugs. The bathtub was full of rust I cannot give my 2 year old a bath in there. The bed was full of sand. The room did not smell very good. (I thought they were cleaning it???) We took everything right back down and checked out. They did not ask any questions. It's like they know what a dump it is. Also the door had a big chunk missing by the lock it would have been very easy to break in. We checked in to the hotel next door and did not have any problems there. As I was checking in there was another lady checking in that had also left the bermuda house. She said she found a pubic hair in her bed. Yuck

Reviews.Title: “Not at all that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bermuda House provided a very comfortable stay for our vacation. Yes, the rooms are a bit old, but they were clean, had a frig, microwave, and stove. The door locked, but the secondary bolt would not, but that was ok theres a top slot lock once your inside. The door did lock when you closed the door and you need the card key to enter, so it was safe. There also is a safe in each room. Security was all around the premises and provded a safe feeling and were very helpful in answering any questions. Had cable TV, view of the beach, terrace door worked fine, pool was clean and front desk service and cleaning crew were helpful and accomodating. The elevator was a slow, so we used the stairs mostly. The palce was packed so this was to be expected. I honeslty cant understand all the negative feedback given here. We had a very enjoyable stay, and would like to thank the staff and security for their hard work and effort in making our visit safe and comfortable. For the price they charge, you cannot go wrong. NO, its not a 5 star hotel, but then a gain a 5 star will cost 5 times the price as well. I will definitiely visit again and plan on staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge a Hotel by it's Internet Photos”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had been in Disney for a week, so we REALLY needed a RELAXING vacation! We saw the internet photos of this lovely place online and thought it would be a nice place to stay~WRONG! The day we arrived, we had NO towels in our room. Noone downstairs could bring them to me but we could gladly come and get them. The elevator is another story. It had not been inspected since last year. I can understand why because I don't see how the thing would meet inspections. It rattled so loud and was extremely loud as it moved. My room door had a crack in it about 1/2 inch so anyone walking by could see us in our room. Our balcony was cracking. It was a NIGHTMARE! The second day, we had towels but NO washcloths and the 3rd day~ NO SERVICE at all! The beds were left unmade and the towels were thrown onto our bed. I called immediately that night and reported it. The last day, the elevator in the back was torn up and we had to drag all of our belongings down the stairwells that did I mention smelled of poo?? As we checked out, my husband complained of the service and the guy at the front desk said we should have reported it. As if I hadn't made enough phone calls to the front office. I HIGHLY recommend that you don't go based on the pictures from the web, or you WILL be disappointed! WE WERE!

Reviews.Title: “Most awful accommodation I've stayed in around the world”
Reviews.Author: ozbev
Reviews.Content: We were accommodated here to attend a timeshare presentation. Just going up to our room in the lift was experience and dread enough. It was filthy and then we saw the hallway carpet which defied description. It was so bad. The door of our room did not fit so we were unable to close it for the two nights we stayed. There were three teenage lads in the room next door and they spent the whole night backwards and forwards to some girls down the hallway banging and crashing about. When I went to the laundry on the floor below had to pass several rooms and there were children and dogs running about as if it was residential housing. Everywhere was just filthy and rubbish all over. I think this hotel should be reported to a governing body for accommodation in the state of Florida because it was atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Awful-words can't describe it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to adequately describe my experience in this pit they call a "hotel". My parents and I went on a weekend trip down to Daytona, and my mother (who made the reservations) must have looked at the pictures when it was newer or newly renovated. Boy were they wrong! We had to squeeze into this insanely tiny parking spot, because apparently they were repaving the remainder parking lot at the time of our stay. The elevator was awful-really old and slow. Our room was disgusting-the mirrors looked like they hadn't been cleaned in weeks. Balcony doors impossible to open; kitchen full of rust spots (basically old and unclean anyway). The TV did work pretty well, and the man who was on staff for maintenance responded pretty quickly to a call that we made. I am pretty sure we saw sheets laying in the hallway, if I remember correctly. No one else has noted that the walls are very thin-when I was in the bathroom the following morning, I heard a man vomiting next door in his bathroom. The whole stay (even though only overnight) was a horrible experience-I was very uncomfortable and I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never, Never Again”
Reviews.Author: johnpitt11
Reviews.Content: This is not a Hotel, it is some type of JOKE. 1. Elevator is a Death Trap. Also goes to various floors even when not pressed. 2. Bathtub has large chunks missing and peeling. 3. You must hold commode handle down for 30 sec. for it to flush. 4. Shower sprays water everywhere. 5. Water never even got luke warm. 6. Microwave absolutely full of Rust. 7. Floor around stove and refrigerator filthy with rust and dirt..you should see between them. Horrible. 8. Carpet filthy with hundreds of black dirty spots on it. 9. Sheets on one bed had White Paint dried on it. The same sheets were on the bed when we checked out 5 days later. 10. Soap and shampoo not left for 2 days, coffe pot was not emptied or grounds removed for 5 days. 11. Bathroom Wall Vinyl painted and ripped around the paper holder which is about to fall off the wall. If you are brave enough to walk to the desk, you will notice the filthy hallway carpet, holes and patches in the walls. Do not be misled or fooled by any reviews that give a rating above Horrible...They did not stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Bermuda House
HotelInfo.Address: 2560 N Atlantic Ave, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
